subject: Added capabilities/options to 'openstack flavor list' command to match capabilities already provided by 'nova flavor-list':
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-03 15:58:21.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/flavor.py', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_flavor.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/flavor.rst'], 'message': 'Added capabilities/options to 'openstack flavor list'
command to match capabilities already provided by
'nova flavor-list':

—public | --private | --all options allows to list
public only (default), private only or all flavors.

—long displays more field. This option also fetches
properties (extra-specs) for each flavor using separate
API call for each flavor and it’s too slow to be done by
default. However as an administrator - sometimes I need
to be able to see them for all flavors.

Removed empty “Extra Specs” column as well as "Swap" and
"RXTX Factor" from default output.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1416780

Change-Id: I30cfa2c75e28daf17b936543a177c23ae1743c37
'}]
commit_message:
Added capabilities/options to 'openstack flavor list'
command to match capabilities already provided by
'nova flavor-list':

—public | --private | --all options allows to list
public only (default), private only or all flavors.

—long displays more field. This option also fetches
properties (extra-specs) for each flavor using separate
API call for each flavor and it’s too slow to be done by
default. However as an administrator - sometimes I need
to be able to see them for all flavors.

Removed empty “Extra Specs” column as well as "Swap" and
"RXTX Factor" from default output.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1416780

Change-Id: I30cfa2c75e28daf17b936543a177c23ae1743c37

subject: Remove image to local block device mapping
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-06 06:01:03.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/servers.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Remove image to local block device mapping

In the method named from_api in nova/block_device.py,

    if source_type == 'image' and destination_type == 'local':
        raise exception.InvalidBDMFormat(
            details=_("Mapping image to local is not supported."))

While, in the method named _boot in novaclient/v2/servers.py

    if image:
        bdm_dict = {'uuid': image.id, 'source_type': 'image',
                    'destination_type': 'local', 'boot_index': 0,
                    'delete_on_termination': True}
        block_device_mapping_v2.insert(0, bdm_dict)

Because of the above, if using --image and --block-device
params at the same time to create vm, nova would
raise InvalidBDMFormat exception

To resolve this problem, remove the codes in novaclient which
conflict with nova

Change-Id: I488322ba0160100a6d641fde68fa824d0581956a
Closes-Bug:#1418484
'}]
commit_message:
Remove image to local block device mapping

In the method named from_api in nova/block_device.py,

    if source_type == 'image' and destination_type == 'local':
        raise exception.InvalidBDMFormat(
            details=_("Mapping image to local is not supported."))

While, in the method named _boot in novaclient/v2/servers.py

    if image:
        bdm_dict = {'uuid': image.id, 'source_type': 'image',
                    'destination_type': 'local', 'boot_index': 0,
                    'delete_on_termination': True}
        block_device_mapping_v2.insert(0, bdm_dict)

Because of the above, if using --image and --block-device
params at the same time to create vm, nova would
raise InvalidBDMFormat exception

To resolve this problem, remove the codes in novaclient which
conflict with nova

Change-Id: I488322ba0160100a6d641fde68fa824d0581956a
Closes-Bug:#1418484

commit_message:
Update the template to add section for projects

Now that the specs being added to the qa-specs repo can effect more
than 1 project, it'll be useful to explicitly call out which projects
are intended to be changed as part of the spec. This commit adds a new
section to the qa-specs template to list the projects which need to
be changed.

Change-Id: I1b7b7f86a0b3275eb7ee6f1a298ae1588270eb83

commit_message:
Add partial ironic upgrade support

Moves checks of DO_NOT_UPGRADE_SERVICES to a function, and
uses it to also setup for partial Ironic upgrades, where we
upgrade the entire cloud except for ironic-api and ironic-condcutor.
This also ends up adding ironic to services that are acted upon
in check-sanity and stop-base.

Change-Id: I392b41d956bc1b0c0eb8383f0eaad9b0c5461760

commit_message:
Fixes incorrect command syntax

The command syntax for # /etc/init.d/procps.sh restart
 doesn’t work, the correct one for Linux and Debian
 is # /etc/init.d/networking restart, for RHEL, Fedora, CentOS,
 OpenSUSE and SLES: # service network restart

Change-Id: I82e13ef205d9fb9ad78a25674374725898dc87e1
Closes-Bug: #1416465

subject: Fix race on default role creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-06 19:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': "Fix race on default role creation

In add_user_to_project() it checks if the default role exists before
trying to add the role to the user and project. If it doesn't exist it
will attempt to create the role. However if 2 requests happen at
roughly the same time the 2 role creations will race causing one to
fail with a conflict error. This patch addresses this issue by catching
the conflict exception and treating it as the create succeeded (which it
did just elsewhere)

Change-Id: Iab95ed8b3913c020eafa919231d764ba8b780571
Closes-Bug: #1419043
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race on default role creation

In add_user_to_project() it checks if the default role exists before
trying to add the role to the user and project. If it doesn't exist it
will attempt to create the role. However if 2 requests happen at
roughly the same time the 2 role creations will race causing one to
fail with a conflict error. This patch addresses this issue by catching
the conflict exception and treating it as the create succeeded (which it
did just elsewhere)

Change-Id: Iab95ed8b3913c020eafa919231d764ba8b780571
Closes-Bug: #1419043

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-06 04:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cli/simple_read_only/compute/test_nova.py'], 'message': "Fix import in nova cli tests

The min version decorator was references the full qualified name for
the decorator but the cli module is imported as just cli in the test
module. Why this isn't causing an error remains unknown (it fails
flake8 locally on my system) but regardless this patch fixes the
issue and corrects the call.

Change-Id: I916d6621ab93900355fa1cb2b114afecbdc60b33

commit_message:
Fix import in nova cli tests

The min version decorator was references the full qualified name for
the decorator but the cli module is imported as just cli in the test
module. Why this isn't causing an error remains unknown (it fails
flake8 locally on my system) but regardless this patch fixes the
issue and corrects the call.

Change-Id: I916d6621ab93900355fa1cb2b114afecbdc60b33

[{'number': 30, 'created': '2015-02-06 01:35:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_projects.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v3/utils.py', 'keystoneclient/v3/projects.py'], 'message': "Hierarchical multitenancy basic calls

This patch addresses changes needed to manage projects through
keystoneclient API v3. The changes are:

create:
  new param 'parent': set the parent project of the project being created

get:
  new param 'subtree_as_list': If True, shows projects down the hierarchy
  new param 'parents_as_list': If True, shows projects up the hierarchy

Co-Authored-By: Andre Aranha <afaranha@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
Hierarchical multitenancy basic calls

This patch addresses changes needed to manage projects through
keystoneclient API v3. The changes are:

create:
  new param 'parent': set the parent project of the project being created

get:
  new param 'subtree_as_list': If True, shows projects down the hierarchy
  new param 'parents_as_list': If True, shows projects up the hierarchy

Co-Authored-By: Andre Aranha <afaranha@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I0f02a66e6a29584197ed00cb32caecb50956f458
Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy

commit_message:
Remove dead code in Neutron DHCP agent for dnsmasq lease script

In fix of bug 1202392, there was dead code left [1]. Patch [2] cleans up
 the dead code including unused environment variable, which requires 
changes to the dhcp.filters file. In order to merge [2], this upgrade is 
necessary.

This has been release-noted in [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37580/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/152398/
[3] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Kilo#Upgrade_Notes_6

Change-Id: Id9a44b2109e7649b33c201be6b9bad675dd30616

commit_message:
Drop deprecated namespace for oslo.rootwrap

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries.[1]
oslo.rootwrap suggests to use oslo_rootwrap.cmd:main.[2]

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/drop-namespace-packages
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.rootwrap#using

Change-Id: I677f682cf94047e9759c519ed8f3024710e0f4d6

Use a workarounds group option to disable live snaphots.

Create a workarounds option to disable live snapshotting rather than
hack MIN_LIBVIRT_LIVESNAPSHOT_VERSION.

DocImpact

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-20 10:10:07.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/policy.json'], 'message': 'Add missing policy for nova in policy.json

the policy file is default shipped nova policy file.
However, some actions such as reboot only have policy
check at compute layer, not in API layer. So the
etc/nova/policy.json as sample should contain the
configuration to end users.
The other patches will handle incorrect setting of
compute layer policies.

Prtially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I66e20d9898ac4cc8787ce7c495ade4038eb4da52
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing policy for nova in policy.json

the policy file is default shipped nova policy file.
However, some actions such as reboot only have policy
check at compute layer, not in API layer. So the
etc/nova/policy.json as sample should contain the
configuration to end users.
The other patches will handle incorrect setting of
compute layer policies.

Prtially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I66e20d9898ac4cc8787ce7c495ade4038eb4da52

commit_message:
Treat LOG.warning and LOG.warn same

8510d3aaeeb18bdbe333d2d5d4c335f3732c4848 removed N331
checking, so now we need treat LOG.warn and LOG.warning
same, so this patch adds the same checking to LOG.warn.

Change-Id: Ifb3addfe116f8f7abb8750826b0217dfbd766439

commit_message:
Stop neutron services more explicitly

After an unstack.sh several neutron services are left running. This
change tries to do a better (but not always successful) job of
stopping neutron agents.

stop_process does its own checking to see if a service is enabled
so we don't need to check before calling.

Change-Id: I8becbe9db56121cbc619a6d156b18f6c6d31a6e7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-06 18:59:16.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/keypairs.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Adds support for x509 certificates as keypairs

Adds new parameter --key-type for novaclient for creating x509
certificates as keypairs. If no --key-type is specified, a ssh
keypair is created, for backwards compatibility.
Adds 'Type' column for keypair-list, displaying the keypair type.

This commit will have to merge after:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140313

Change-Id: I7df3678b97594ad0a6403b7a83ccee6e2c334771
Implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for x509 certificates as keypairs

Adds new parameter --key-type for novaclient for creating x509
certificates as keypairs. If no --key-type is specified, a ssh
keypair is created, for backwards compatibility.
Adds 'Type' column for keypair-list, displaying the keypair type.

This commit will have to merge after:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140313

Change-Id: I7df3678b97594ad0a6403b7a83ccee6e2c334771
Implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 9312, 'name': 'Alexandre Levine', 'email': 'alexandrelevine@gmail.com', 'username': 'alevine'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10224, 'name': 'Feodor Tersin', 'email': 'ftersin@hotmail.com', 'username': 'ftersin'}, {'_account_id': 10234, 'name': 'Andrey Pavlov', 'email': 'andrey.mp@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrey-mp'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11224, 'name': 'Swami Reddy', 'email': 'swamireddy@gmail.com', 'username': 'swamireddy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-03 13:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/api-paste.ini', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py'], 'message': "Make EC2 compatible with current AWS CLI.

AWS CLI is a recommended Amazon's CLI and it uses botocore library instead of
boto to access EC2 API:
http://aws.amazon.com/cli/

Amazon's URL for AWS EC2 API is:
https://ec2.amazonaws.com/

OpenStack nova's EC2 API service URL is:
http://some.server.com:8773/services/Cloud

AWS CLI works with the root URLs (without something trailing, like ../services/Cloud).
This is so because of the following bug in botocore:
https://github.com/boto/botocore/issues/420

We did supply the fix here:
https://github.com/Andrey-mp/botocore/commit/162bdc22de3ff3d6243459c132ca9bd01e02533f

However, we do not control botocore and cannot predict when this fix is going to be
applied or guarantee that in the future nothing alike happens again (in fact, older
botocore didn't have this bug).
Another problem is that there is a set of Tempest tests currently used to work against
stackforge/ec2-api but which is about to be employed against nova's ec2-api.
These Tempest tests use botocore too. And won't work with the nova's EC2-API
until either botocore or nova is fixed.

So we suggest to fix the situation in nova by changing the URL to http://some.server.com:8773/.
It'll provide the solution for OpenStack independent of botocore bugs
and fixes in this area, and will make the service URL more alike (compatible, sort of)
with the AWS EC2 API.

Change-Id: If9fcddcd455090f4b76a16251f69b361d6260291
Closes-Bug: 1417555
"}]
commit_message:
Make EC2 compatible with current AWS CLI.

AWS CLI is a recommended Amazon's CLI and it uses botocore library instead of
boto to access EC2 API:
http://aws.amazon.com/cli/

Amazon's URL for AWS EC2 API is:
https://ec2.amazonaws.com/

OpenStack nova's EC2 API service URL is:
http://some.server.com:8773/services/Cloud

AWS CLI works with the root URLs (without something trailing, like ../services/Cloud).
This is so because of the following bug in botocore:
https://github.com/boto/botocore/issues/420

We did supply the fix here:
https://github.com/Andrey-mp/botocore/commit/162bdc22de3ff3d6243459c132ca9bd01e02533f

However, we do not control botocore and cannot predict when this fix is going to be
applied or guarantee that in the future nothing alike happens again (in fact, older
botocore didn't have this bug).
Another problem is that there is a set of Tempest tests currently used to work against
stackforge/ec2-api but which is about to be employed against nova's ec2-api.
These Tempest tests use botocore too. And won't work with the nova's EC2-API
until either botocore or nova is fixed.

So we suggest to fix the situation in nova by changing the URL to http://some.server.com:8773/.
It'll provide the solution for OpenStack independent of botocore bugs
and fixes in this area, and will make the service URL more alike (compatible, sort of)
with the AWS EC2 API.

Change-Id: If9fcddcd455090f4b76a16251f69b361d6260291
Closes-Bug: 1417555

commit_message:
add angular-bootstrap to jasmine spec runner page

There are a few widgets have dependency on angular-bootstrap.
When those widgets' module defined with dependency `ui.bootstrap',
Jasmine spec runner page will be brocken. This patch prevents that
from happening.

Change-Id: I8857ce74290b90f2cfd7a455b6af726192637053

used to preserve the environment.

Change-Id: Ice5cf0bca65d8078f84daedbef123fc73d5a7b63
"}]
commit_message:
Use sudo -E when squashing package installs files

Since the package-installs-squash script  relies on the defined
environment variables for figuring out what the values are for an
element's install type and the default install types, sudo -E must be
used to preserve the environment.

Change-Id: Ice5cf0bca65d8078f84daedbef123fc73d5a7b63

commit_message:
VMware: consolidate NSX models

This patch moves all the models for the NSX plugin currently in trunk
into a single module. The module neutron.db.migration.models.head is
also updated accordingly.

This patches is aimed at simplifying the decomposition of the VMware
NSX plugin.

Related blueprint core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: I32be9996a76ab874d1b982f0be10ae393d48060b

commit_message:
ec2api tempest job

This creates a non voting check job for ec2api changes that includes
setting up a devstack environment using an external devstack plugin in
a zuul compatible way. This is also a good reference for other teams
that would like test jobs which include devstack external plugins.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10206, 'name': 'Madhuri Kumari', 'email': 'madhuri.kumari@intel.com', 'username': 'Madhuri'}, {'_account_id': 14123, 'name': 'Stefano Canepa', 'email': 'sc@linux.it', 'username': 'sc'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 20:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh'], 'message': "Allow customization of nameserver defaults

The recommended way to configure the nameserver setting
is via your environments testenv.json file. This doesn't
always work however because we have (shared) automation
that uses the same testenv.json's (TripleO CI) where
sometimes you may want an external nameserver and
sometimes you don't.

This patch allows the use of SEED_NAMESERVER and
UNDERCLOUD_NAMESERVER variables to control the
default nameserver setting.

This should help facilitate using TripleO CI with
RDO packages which have RPM repos URLs that need
a nameserver.

Change-Id: Ie5a765d7f32afe6630fbed026b1a2c635794ce74
"}]
commit_message:
Allow customization of nameserver defaults

The recommended way to configure the nameserver setting
is via your environments testenv.json file. This doesn't
always work however because we have (shared) automation
that uses the same testenv.json's (TripleO CI) where
sometimes you may want an external nameserver and
sometimes you don't.

This patch allows the use of SEED_NAMESERVER and
UNDERCLOUD_NAMESERVER variables to control the
default nameserver setting.

This should help facilitate using TripleO CI with
RDO packages which have RPM repos URLs that need
a nameserver.

Change-Id: Ie5a765d7f32afe6630fbed026b1a2c635794ce74

commit_message:
Fix improper use of Stevedore

The tests in nova/tests/test_hook.py are mocking a private part
of the stevedore API (_load_plugins). We should use
HookManager.make_test_instance() to create a test version
of an HookManager and use that.

Change-Id: Iafacd9f08e8c714eed071c5ff41c9eeed4e1130c

subject: Check for nova DB availability in dependent containers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-21 00:34:32.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova-controller/nova-api/start.sh', 'docker/nova-controller/nova-scheduler/start.sh', 'docker/fedora-rdo-base/kolla-common.sh', 'docker/nova-base/config-nova.sh'], 'message': "Check for nova DB availability in dependent containers

When nova-api start and the nova database hasn't yet been created, it
would create it itself, preventing the migration in nova-conductor to
run and making it unable to start. This commit ensures that nova-api
container will not try to steal nova-conductor's job of creating the
nova database.

Nova-scheduler reacts differently to the missing database and simply
exits with a backtrace. This commit also prevents nova-scheduler to
start when the nova database cannot be found.

Change-Id: Ib6f7521151815faa7a26ec1d170df5a1cdb7fd63
Related-Bug: #1335804
"}]
commit_message:
Check for nova DB availability in dependent containers

When nova-api start and the nova database hasn't yet been created, it
would create it itself, preventing the migration in nova-conductor to
run and making it unable to start. This commit ensures that nova-api
container will not try to steal nova-conductor's job of creating the
nova database.

Nova-scheduler reacts differently to the missing database and simply
exits with a backtrace. This commit also prevents nova-scheduler to
start when the nova database cannot be found.

Change-Id: Ib6f7521151815faa7a26ec1d170df5a1cdb7fd63
Related-Bug: #1335804

subject: Cleanup required variables checks for all containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-19 07:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ceilometer/ceilometer-central/start.sh', 'docker/neutron/agents/linux-bridge/start.sh', 'docker/ceilometer/ceilometer-base/config-ceilometer.sh', 'docker/heat/heat-base/config-heat.sh', 'docker/barbican/start.sh', 'docker/glance/glance-base/config-glance.sh', 'docker/neutron/agents/l3/start.sh', 'docker/nova-controller/nova-api/start.sh', 'docker/zaqar/start.sh', 'docker/swift/swift-account/start.sh', 'docker/neutron/agents/dhcp/start.sh', 'docker/ceilometer/ceilometer-api/start.sh', 'docker/neutron/agents/metadata/start.sh', 'docker/swift/swift-object/start.sh', 'docker/neutron/neutron-base/config-neutron.sh', 'docker/swift/swift-container/start.sh', 'docker/keystone/start.sh', 'docker/nova-controller/nova-conductor/start.sh', 'docker/cinder/start.sh', 'docker/nova-base/config-nova.sh', 'docker/heat/heat-engine/start.sh', 'docker/ceilometer/ceilometer-compute/start.sh', 'docker/neutron/neutron-server/start.sh', 'docker/horizon/start.sh'], 'message': 'Cleanup required variables checks for all containers

This allows Kubernetes to reschedule containers in case a required
variable is missing, for example when the Kubernetes pod is started
before the service.

The checks were cleaned using the following method:
  * remove duplicates
  * remove check for variables that get a default value in the same file
  * check for all variables used in the file
  * check for required services when it is obvious.

Change-Id: Ib7e0530c410c61f828d36efe8925a20dc9781eab
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup required variables checks for all containers

This allows Kubernetes to reschedule containers in case a required
variable is missing, for example when the Kubernetes pod is started
before the service.

The checks were cleaned using the following method:
  * remove duplicates
  * remove check for variables that get a default value in the same file
  * check for all variables used in the file
  * check for required services when it is obvious.

Change-Id: Ib7e0530c410c61f828d36efe8925a20dc9781eab

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-29 17:12:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': "neutron: allow allocate if port id specified with 'default' sec group

Commit d8cafb9a6efb95b78609aca8fcb3532c33a1788f added a check in the
neutronv2 API's allocate_for_instance flow where if a port id is
specified for the boot AND a security group is specified, it will raise
an error since if you're using Neutron it's expected that you're letting
Neutron handle security group associations for the port and instance.

However, if you don't specify a security group in Nova the 'default'
security group is always added by the compute API, so this will always
break when a port id is specified when creating an instance in Nova.

This change simply checks to see if there is a port id requested and
only one security group specified on the request AND that is the
'default' security group, it's not an error.

By the way, we totally need a Tempest test for this use case since
the unit tests in Nova are so brittle around this functionality...

Closes-Bug: #1415835

Change-Id: I943f4998571ac074cbbf1c69c8f5843bb87e4bf1
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: allow allocate if port id specified with 'default' sec group

Commit d8cafb9a6efb95b78609aca8fcb3532c33a1788f added a check in the
neutronv2 API's allocate_for_instance flow where if a port id is
specified for the boot AND a security group is specified, it will raise
an error since if you're using Neutron it's expected that you're letting
Neutron handle security group associations for the port and instance.

However, if you don't specify a security group in Nova the 'default'
security group is always added by the compute API, so this will always
break when a port id is specified when creating an instance in Nova.

This change simply checks to see if there is a port id requested and
only one security group specified on the request AND that is the
'default' security group, it's not an error.

By the way, we totally need a Tempest test for this use case since
the unit tests in Nova are so brittle around this functionality...

Closes-Bug: #1415835

Change-Id: I943f4998571ac074cbbf1c69c8f5843bb87e4bf1

commit_message:
Revert "Raise if sec-groups and port id are provided on boot"

This reverts commit d8cafb9a6efb95b78609aca8fcb3532c33a1788f.

The above commit assumes that security_groups can be empty. However,
it will always have had the default security_group added to it,
meaning that with this patch it is never possible to specify a port
it.

Closes-bug: #1415835
Change-Id: I01b561ac8b9b29cc4721d88567678a42a4fd1f6b

commit_message:
Fix aggregation race when no timeserie exists

In case of we made a aggregation across metrics that doesn't match
any existing timeseries an exception is raised instead of an empty
list.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I50a78d739d64c37efc3fbc1d0c364df9e745ebb4

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-04 11:44:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/servicegroup/drivers/zk.py', 'nova/tests/unit/servicegroup/test_zk_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix conductor servicegroup joining when zk driver is used

When conductor is run as multiprocess (default for multi core system) and
zk (zookeeper) is used as servicegroup_driver then conductor is unable to join
servicegroup because of shared zookeeper handle (and probably socket)
between parent and children processes.

It's found the problem lies in zookeeper c library implementation.
Proof can be seen in related bug #1389782.

This fix follows the idea used by memcache and db driver that
servicegroup_api._driver object is used in lazy manner.
This means that like connection to memcache and session to database,
zookeeper handle (zk session in driver) isn't created until required by
worker (child process).

Additional note: before fix, during Service object creation the
prefix in zookeeper was created. That was the probably reason the session was
established so early. In my opinion the eagerness of this is not necessary
and namespace can be created by child process as well.

Closes-Bug: #1389782

Related-bug: #1390511
Related-bug: #1382153

Change-Id: I9b386ef1f9268d19d04879ec89e5684170f3862a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix conductor servicegroup joining when zk driver is used

When conductor is run as multiprocess (default for multi core system) and
zk (zookeeper) is used as servicegroup_driver then conductor is unable to join
servicegroup because of shared zookeeper handle (and probably socket)
between parent and children processes.

It's found the problem lies in zookeeper c library implementation.
Proof can be seen in related bug #1389782.

This fix follows the idea used by memcache and db driver that
servicegroup_api._driver object is used in lazy manner.
This means that like connection to memcache and session to database,
zookeeper handle (zk session in driver) isn't created until required by
worker (child process).

Additional note: before fix, during Service object creation the
prefix in zookeeper was created. That was the probably reason the session was
established so early. In my opinion the eagerness of this is not necessary
and namespace can be created by child process as well.

Closes-Bug: #1389782

Related-bug: #1390511
Related-bug: #1382153

Change-Id: I9b386ef1f9268d19d04879ec89e5684170f3862a

commit_message:
Add minimal ubuntu and centos base elements

There are times when a much more stripped down base image is desired
over the distro cloud images. For instance, Infra would like some base
images that do not have cloud-init or really much of anything else. This
is easy to accomplish with debootstrap and rinse.

Change-Id: I44ff22457165afb048fdaea469210ae47d83dd3f

commit_message:
Add console log support

This design spec introduces the console log support in Ironic.
It specifies how to log the console and retrieve the console
log output. It includes adding new functions in the common
driver interface, adding new REST API to get console log
as well as implementing the new functions in ipmitool and
ipminative drivers.

Change-Id: Ief328a51ca6c4a7a5e4ac135d023b22c5d69c4a6

commit_message:
Make prevent_l3_port_deletion handle missing port

This adjusts the prevent_l3_port_deletion function to handle
the case where the port ID that is passed to it does not have
an entry in the database.

Previously it was raising an exception in this case, which is
inconsistent to how ML2 was handling concurrent port_delete requests
further in the port delete function (log them but don't fail).

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py

Closes-Bug: #1416554
Change-Id: I6da021bdf0c79f72336416d02ab989407f352904

commit_message:
oslo: migrate to namespace-less import paths

Oslo project decided to move away from using oslo.* namespace for all their
libraries [1], so we should migrate to new import path.

This patch applies new paths for:
- oslo.config
- oslo.db
- oslo.i18n
- oslo.messaging
- oslo.middleware
- oslo.rootwrap
- oslo.serialization
- oslo.utils

Added hacking check to enforce new import paths for all oslo libraries.

Updated setup.cfg entry points.

We'll cleanup old imports from oslo-incubator modules on demand or
if/when oslo officially deprecates old namespace in one of the next
cycles.

[1]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/drop-namespace-packages

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147248/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/152292/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147240/

Closes-Bug: #1409733
Change-Id: If0dce29a0980206ace9866112be529436194d47e

DO NOT MERGE testing nova multinode fix

This tests the fix for shelving and unshelving with nova network against
the changes to do multinode testing. We will use this to confirm that
both multinode nova network and tempest are happy with this change.

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-02-05 05:08:59.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/shell.py', 'tests/test_shell.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Return 130 for keyboard interrupt

When keyboard interrupt is received by glanceclient, the return code as
of now is 1.

But since the client was terminated by an keyboard interrupt, the return
code should be 130. (http://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/exitcodes.html)
It is useful when people are writing automation test cases and want to
validate based on the return code.

Change-Id: Ia70116ab6f0708a0ce6eeaed07c1e7a56e68c9f4
Closes-Bug: #1373231
'}]
commit_message:
Return 130 for keyboard interrupt

When keyboard interrupt is received by glanceclient, the return code as
of now is 1.

But since the client was terminated by an keyboard interrupt, the return
code should be 130. (http://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/exitcodes.html)
It is useful when people are writing automation test cases and want to
validate based on the return code.

Change-Id: Ia70116ab6f0708a0ce6eeaed07c1e7a56e68c9f4
Closes-Bug: #1373231

subject: Fixes incorrect mkdir syntax
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-30 01:22:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/training-guides/common/editing-code.xml'], 'message': 'Fixes incorrect mkdir syntax

Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines ng the Tools
and Accounts for Committing Code" section, the command listed is:

 $ mkdir /Users/username/code/

This command fails on a new system as those parent directories likely
don't exist. Correct syntax should be:

 $ mkdir -p /Users/username/code/

Change-Id: I7ccb108ed035a6b736f8e531cc8e2b7345f44a4e
Closes-bug: #1406343
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes incorrect mkdir syntax

Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines ng the Tools
and Accounts for Committing Code" section, the command listed is:

 $ mkdir /Users/username/code/

This command fails on a new system as those parent directories likely
don't exist. Correct syntax should be:

 $ mkdir -p /Users/username/code/

Change-Id: I7ccb108ed035a6b736f8e531cc8e2b7345f44a4e
Closes-bug: #1406343

commit_message:
Remove the default project from all users

The default project means that a user gains token scoping information
for a project if they don't specify another. This is something we want
to discourage for user creation. User's should specify there own
authentication scope when they authenticate.

Change-Id: I42c3060d59edfcd44d04cd166bad500419dd99bc

This change shifts a few things from the old contributing.rst file and
begins to expand in a few areas. A lot of the contents are broken out
into separate files, and there's a start on guidelines of how to
contribute new features for services.

commit_message:
Build up user documentation section

This change creates a section of the documentation focused on users,
holding the guides, API docs, etc. Another change will focus on
documentation for contributors.

* Installation details were moved straight into the user index.
  Installation details for contributors will go into that section.
* The old usage.rst section was moved into the userguides/ section and
  will grow into a Connection guide in another change.
* The sections were organized according top to bottom in order of
  likelihood of utility to users. The guides will help people get
  started, the API docs will help them go from there, and anyone needing
  to customize lower-level things will have already scrolled through the
  preceeding sections to get to the end.
* In order to see how the Resource docs turn out to be organized, I
  added pages for Compute and Database resources. We'll need to add them
  for every service, but I didn't want to overload this change with all
  of those additions.
* Since glossary isn't linked in a TOC anywhere, just mentioned
  explicitly at the beginning of the user section, I added an exclude
  for it in the conf.py. It still gets built, but that allows it to not
  become a warning for being left out of TOCs.

Change-Id: If9d1e4726ed14d5b7592c9da00c27591d2a4291c
Partial-Bug: 1416553

commit_message:
IBP: ubuntu: moved resolv.conf stuff to boothook

The issue is that cloudinit/cc_resolv_conf.py is not working at all.
For both centos and ubuntu resolv.conf editing was moved to
cloud-init boothook stage. cloud-init will recreate resolv.conf on
every boot.

Closes-Bug: 1416399
Change-Id: I3d6fdd15ea279928d39f5e6ce4136372db3172c5
(cherry picked from commit 8286437ef2b76c7b2cb24b3eb588bb14178caf9e)

commit_message:
IBP: ubuntu: moved resolv.conf stuff to boothook

The issue is that cloudinit/cc_resolv_conf.py is not working at all.
For both centos and ubuntu resolv.conf editing was moved to
cloud-init boothook stage. cloud-init will recreate resolv.conf on
every boot.

Closes-Bug: 1416399
Change-Id: I3d6fdd15ea279928d39f5e6ce4136372db3172c5

commit_message:
minor update regarding serial console reqs

I missed the chance to comment on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149533/.  I wanted to suggest this edit
to emphasize that one does not require *python* websocket in particular
to access the serial console, but that any websocket client library
would be appropriate.

Change-Id: Iff82deac5adce5811f884ed14daa7c586fed2dd0

commit_message:
Change to TaskFlow classes

Given the increasing complexity of our tasks, FunctorTasks are no longer
making sense.  This change set modifies the existing Tasks to class
based Tasks, which allow for better organization of moderately complex
tasks.

Does not introduce any new tasks.

Change-Id: Ic0794e6000cc312c1d2af466a7a6bd62662924c6

subject: Fixes for rabbit OCF logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-27 14:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/manifests/rabbitmq.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Fixes for rabbit OCF logic

W/o this fix,
* forget_cluster_node command could take a lot of
  the time (and even out of the time given to post-stop notify event)
  if rabbit node is under heavy load.
* It is also possible that all
  rabbitmq resources could persist as a slaves and there won't be
  any master elected.
* Sometimes, join_cluster could take quite a long of a time. If it exceeded,
  the node will enter into join-wait-reset loop for ever.

The solution includes:
* Disconnect the node being unjoined forcibly from
  the every node issuing the forget action. That would make the forget
  action an instant and would ensure the node will be unjoined and
  reset w/o any issues.
* Increase action start timeout even more and increase minimal value
  for command timeout as well.
* Add info messages about timeouts given for commands execution
* Fix missing OCF_FAILED_MASTER status processing for events and actions
* Fix promote/demote/notify actions - return OCF_FAILED_MASTER then required
* Fix reset_mnesia() procedure and logging prefixes for it
* Replace detached stop_app call to timeout wrapper in stop_rmq_server_app()
  and stop_server_process(). Del del OCF_RESKEY_shutdown_time (unneeded).
* Fix exit code for start_rmq_server_app()
* Fix missing return for jjj_join
* Fix my_host return codes to differ from OCF_ERR_GENERIC
* Fix missing local declarations rc var
* Fix missing rc checks for stop_rmq_server_app() and some other functions
* Add some missing ocf_run wrappers
* Fix shutdown/startup logs redirection

Related-bug: #1396946

Change-Id: I951825badb712c5575d469403cf65bf26713aff0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes for rabbit OCF logic

W/o this fix,
* forget_cluster_node command could take a lot of
  the time (and even out of the time given to post-stop notify event)
  if rabbit node is under heavy load.
* It is also possible that all
  rabbitmq resources could persist as a slaves and there won't be
  any master elected.
* Sometimes, join_cluster could take quite a long of a time. If it exceeded,
  the node will enter into join-wait-reset loop for ever.

The solution includes:
* Disconnect the node being unjoined forcibly from
  the every node issuing the forget action. That would make the forget
  action an instant and would ensure the node will be unjoined and
  reset w/o any issues.
* Increase action start timeout even more and increase minimal value
  for command timeout as well.
* Add info messages about timeouts given for commands execution
* Fix missing OCF_FAILED_MASTER status processing for events and actions
* Fix promote/demote/notify actions - return OCF_FAILED_MASTER then required
* Fix reset_mnesia() procedure and logging prefixes for it
* Replace detached stop_app call to timeout wrapper in stop_rmq_server_app()
  and stop_server_process(). Del del OCF_RESKEY_shutdown_time (unneeded).
* Fix exit code for start_rmq_server_app()
* Fix missing return for jjj_join
* Fix my_host return codes to differ from OCF_ERR_GENERIC
* Fix missing local declarations rc var
* Fix missing rc checks for stop_rmq_server_app() and some other functions
* Add some missing ocf_run wrappers
* Fix shutdown/startup logs redirection

Related-bug: #1396946

Change-Id: I951825badb712c5575d469403cf65bf26713aff0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Wrap OCF rabbitmq commands to timeout -KILL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-27 14:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/nova/controller.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nova/manifests/rabbitmq.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Wrap OCF rabbitmq commands to timeout -KILL

W/o this patch, rabbitmqctl commands issued by rabbitmq RA
could outlast the given timeout for action notify (60 seconds).
That may bring rabbitmq cluster to a state then join_cluster
and start_app commands would never ended as well as the
cluster reassemble process.

The solution is:
* Use limited interval for rabbitmqctl commands which depends on the
  OCF action in progress. Looks like start and notify actions require
  the most of the time to be finished.
* Evaluate interval as (timeout / 6 + 5).
  So, for notify 180 sec timeout it would be 180/6+5=35 sec
  to wait before any command issued by action notify would be killed
* Adjust timeout values for failure-timeout, start and notify 60->180.
  That is required in order to provide enough time for the
  commands to complete consequently w/o being killed by timeout.
* Fix start/shutdown timeout evaluation then recieved a negative value for
  small timeouts (timeout=60s would result in -4 value)

Related-bug: #1396946

Change-Id: I33a0390b311646266522ddd0f4e8c75d762afe30
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Wrap OCF rabbitmq commands to timeout -KILL

W/o this patch, rabbitmqctl commands issued by rabbitmq RA
could outlast the given timeout for action notify (60 seconds).
That may bring rabbitmq cluster to a state then join_cluster
and start_app commands would never ended as well as the
cluster reassemble process.

The solution is:
* Use limited interval for rabbitmqctl commands which depends on the
  OCF action in progress. Looks like start and notify actions require
  the most of the time to be finished.
* Evaluate interval as (timeout / 6 + 5).
  So, for notify 180 sec timeout it would be 180/6+5=35 sec
  to wait before any command issued by action notify would be killed
* Adjust timeout values for failure-timeout, start and notify 60->180.
  That is required in order to provide enough time for the
  commands to complete consequently w/o being killed by timeout.
* Fix start/shutdown timeout evaluation then recieved a negative value for
  small timeouts (timeout=60s would result in -4 value)

Related-bug: #1396946

Change-Id: I33a0390b311646266522ddd0f4e8c75d762afe30
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 14923, 'name': 'Sinval Vieira Mendes Neto', 'email': 'sinvalneto01@gmail.com', 'username': 'sinvalvieira'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-02 07:17:30.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Remove unused env variable option for tenant isolation

'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALLOW_TENANT_ISOLATION' was used to set the
tenant isolation to true for running tempest tests in parallel.

Ida532021e1287efed09343e8e546d0605355e889 has changed the way
to select the tests execution.

By default devstack set the tenant isolation to True in tempest
config. If that needs to be disabled then,
'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_DISABLE_TENANT_ISOLATION' env variable needs
to be set to 1

By having 'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALLOW_TENANT_ISOLATION' unused env
variable in jenkin jobs, create confusion about tenant isolation
setting.

This patch removes 'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALLOW_TENANT_ISOLATION'.

Change-Id: Ia752b88ca0266867dcb3f7580242381a0d98dbb7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused env variable option for tenant isolation

'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALLOW_TENANT_ISOLATION' was used to set the
tenant isolation to true for running tempest tests in parallel.

Ida532021e1287efed09343e8e546d0605355e889 has changed the way
to select the tests execution.

By default devstack set the tenant isolation to True in tempest
config. If that needs to be disabled then,
'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_DISABLE_TENANT_ISOLATION' env variable needs
to be set to 1

By having 'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALLOW_TENANT_ISOLATION' unused env
variable in jenkin jobs, create confusion about tenant isolation
setting.

This patch removes 'DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALLOW_TENANT_ISOLATION'.

Change-Id: Ia752b88ca0266867dcb3f7580242381a0d98dbb7

  rabbitmq resources could persist as a slaves and there won't be
  any master elected.
* Sometimes, join_cluster could take quite a long of a time. If it exceeded,
  the node will enter into join-wait-reset loop for ever.

The solution includes:
* Disconnect the node being unjoined forcibly from
  the every node issuing the forget action. That would make the forget
  action an instant and would ensure the node will be unjoined and

* Increase action start timeout even more and increase minimal value
  for command timeout as well.
* Add info messages about timeouts given for commands execution
* Fix missing OCF_FAILED_MASTER status processing for events and actions
* Fix promote/demote/notify actions - return OCF_FAILED_MASTER then required
* Fix reset_mnesia() procedure and logging prefixes for it
* Replace detached stop_app call to timeout wrapper in stop_rmq_server_app()
  and stop_server_process(). Del del OCF_RESKEY_shutdown_time (unneeded).
* Fix exit code for start_rmq_server_app()
* Fix missing return for jjj_join
* Fix my_host return codes to differ from OCF_ERR_GENERIC
* Fix missing local declarations rc var
* Fix missing rc checks for stop_rmq_server_app() and some other functions

Wrap OCF rabbitmq commands to timeout -KILL

commit_message:
Move mongodb logs to mongod.log

Enables consolidation of MongoDB logs in one location,
instead of polluting /var/log/messages.

Added rotation for /var/log/mongod.log on deployed nodes,
while the current Fuel Master rotation requires no changes.

Change-Id: I3bbc6b87ed9d125191041c310069136c59d8d1f9
Closes-Bug: 1367234
(cherry picked from commit 6d0309ef2fce9b8032185bc01c7122b600844a1b)

subject: puppet: only enable Ntp if ntp::servers is set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-06 13:44:51.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/overcloud_volume.pp', 'puppet/overcloud_object.pp', 'puppet/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/overcloud_compute.pp'], 'message': "puppet: only enable Ntp if ntp::servers is set

Not all installations have an NtpServer configured and if
they don't the ntp service will fail to startup correctly.

This patch makes it so that ntp is only enabled if
the ntp::servers array is greater than 0.

Change-Id: I8417f87ad2a3c1237ebb00ee1232b5313cd45d46
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: only enable Ntp if ntp::servers is set

Not all installations have an NtpServer configured and if
they don't the ntp service will fail to startup correctly.

This patch makes it so that ntp is only enabled if
the ntp::servers array is greater than 0.

Change-Id: I8417f87ad2a3c1237ebb00ee1232b5313cd45d46

subject: puppet: disable swift proxy and glance backend
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-06 13:39:11.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': "puppet: disable swift proxy and glance backend

We have an issue where swift.devices metadata isn't showing
up on our controllers. This causes ringbuilding to fail
meaning swift-proxy won't startup.

This patch disables the swift-proxy and glance swift backend
until we can figure out exactly what caused this change.

Partial-bug: 1418805

commit_message:
puppet: disable swift proxy and glance backend

We have an issue where swift.devices metadata isn't showing
up on our controllers. This causes ringbuilding to fail
meaning swift-proxy won't startup.

This patch disables the swift-proxy and glance swift backend
until we can figure out exactly what caused this change.

Change-Id: I723a4b703d979d7475ac48f41c4c0ac91c306884
Partial-bug: 1418805

commit_message:
[MongoDB] Add regex to complex queries

In our workflow we need to get all samples by instance_id, but
resource_id isn't useful in some meters with extra resource_id
info.  For example: disk.device.read.bytes has a resource_id like
<instance_id>-<disk_type> and if we don't know disk type we
can't get samples by this resource.
In this CR regex complex query is added.

Change-Id: If32c8f94eadd6d55bc91665e91f1cde85dd024de
Partially-Implements: blueprint regexp-in-complex-query

commit_message:
Switch off oslo.* namespace check temporarily

There's lot of code in flight that will break if we switch
on the asserts to error out pep8/flake8 right now. So
we should temporarily switch it off. Doing this as a separate
review so it's easy to revery and stands out on its own.

commit_message:
Add api_version parameter for API sample test base class

When adds new microversion for nova REST API, we need add api sample
test. This patch adds new parameter to pass the requested API version.

For example to test v2.2 version of host API. It only adds new test
function in HostsSampleJsonTest:

    def test_host_get_v22(self):
        response = self._do_get('os-hosts/%s' % self.compute.host,
                                api_version='2.2')
        subs = self._get_regexes()
        self._verify_response('host-get-resp-2-2', subs, response, 200)

'api_version' is used to specifiy the requested version. And provide
template file for this version API's response.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I58ccb82e8614aed2f2f0f33bd76d31adce141fd4

This change tells libvirt to enable the BIOS bootmenu if the image

commit_message:
Enable BIOS bootmenu on AMI-based images

This change tells libvirt to enable the BIOS bootmenu if the image
metadata (property-name "hw_boot_menu") or flavor extra spec
(name "hw:boot_menu") is configured to allow it.

In cases where both the image metadata and Extra Spec are set, the
Extra Spec setting is used.  This allows for flexibility in
setting/overriding the default behavior as needed.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1275311
Change-Id: I1e1d2ef7815d805827ce3a9cbbef023f1b3ca7dc

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo_* instead of oslo.*

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries. Updating the hacking
rule to include a check to prevent oslo.* import from
creeping back in.

This commit includes:
- using oslo_utils instead of oslo.utils
- using oslo_serialization instead of oslo.serialization
- using oslo_db instead of oslo.db
- using oslo_i18n instead of oslo.i18n
- using oslo_middleware instead of oslo.middleware
- using oslo_config instead of oslo.config
- using oslo_messaging instead of "from oslo import messaging"
- using oslo_vmware instead of oslo.vmware

Change-Id: I3e2eb147b321ce3e928817b62abcb7d023c5f13f

commit_message:
[IBP] Fix 'device or resource busy' error in fuel-agent

In short, we've faced udev scaling issues when making a lot of `parted` calls.
As for workaround, blacklisting of rules was choisen. It helps us to mitigate
scaling issues.

The fix was stress tested on a VM with 25 disks by creating 30 partitions per
disk.

Change-Id: Ibec9c0485fba657ef592fee3aab4e7757a705e46
Closes-Bug: #1410471
(cherry picked from commit 44c2a20c2a272a092643dd30a20129ab65bf4c5e)

commit_message:
remove detail method from LimitsController

we should remove the detail method from the LimitsController class
because the detail is not the default method and it doesn't add the
detail operation in the _setup_routes method from the class APIRouter

Change-Id: I7944f5d3b43433093d76d2925eaf0568c68d4a49
Closes-Bug: #1403441

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-01-26 15:14:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix bdm transformation for volume backed servers

When volume backed server is snapshoted with nova image-create
then the image is created with a proper bdm. However when this
image is booted with image->volume bdm the two bdms are not
merged properly and the server cannot be booted as it gets two
boot_index = 0 device

This patch solves the issue by removing the unnecessary device
from the mapping.

Closes-bug: #1381598

Change-Id: I170e80d35fe8a8d906370a507148351926763a13
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bdm transformation for volume backed servers

When volume backed server is snapshoted with nova image-create
then the image is created with a proper bdm. However when this
image is booted with image->volume bdm the two bdms are not
merged properly and the server cannot be booted as it gets two
boot_index = 0 device

This patch solves the issue by removing the unnecessary device
from the mapping.

Closes-bug: #1381598

Change-Id: I170e80d35fe8a8d906370a507148351926763a13

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-02-05 09:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': "Avoid TypeError creating instance with IP

When I'm using command below to create an instance with specific ip,
it failed.
nova boot --image cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec --flavor m1.nano --nic
net-id=5b7930ae-ff24-4dcf-a429-e039cb7502dd,v4-fixed-ip=10.0.0.5 test

Closes-bug: #1396854
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid TypeError creating instance with IP

When I'm using command below to create an instance with specific ip,
it failed.
nova boot --image cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec --flavor m1.nano --nic
net-id=5b7930ae-ff24-4dcf-a429-e039cb7502dd,v4-fixed-ip=10.0.0.5 test

In nova-compute.log
TypeError: coercing to Unicode: need string or buffer, IPAddress found

Fixes the bug by changing IPAddress to string when creating a neutron
port.

Change-Id: I04e5c1c392f5c46f663fc4ae8c15b27563b4b3b7
Closes-bug: #1396854

commit_message:
meta data and uuid for tests

The purpose of this spec is to define a standard for attaching meta data such
as Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs) to tests that are to be used by
tempest. This specification should be enforced both for tests that are to live
in the tempest repository as well as tests that will eventually reside within
their own repositories.

Change-Id: I443f6ebe8cc83300b2e83cae79ba753d98ed9569
Co-Authored-By: Chris Hoge <chris@openstack.org>

commit_message:
OpenStack workload VMs info export to CSV

VMs info export to CSV implemented. Export uses DB. Export
uses data streaming.
Installation info exporter renamed.
Common CSV export logic extracted to export_utils module.
SQLAlchemy and psycopg added to requirements.
DB credentials added into config.
SQL debug enabled for test configuration.

Implements: blueprint openstack-workload-statistics
Change-Id: I8a9a04e1a2462a3a8d3950e20daa92025a7de11b

auto-configuration for Cinder with GlusterFS

To enable GlusterFS add following to your localrc:

* CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=glusterfs:glusterfs
* CINDER_GLUSTERFS_SHARES (optional)

Implements: blueprint implement-glusterfs-backend
'}]
commit_message:
Deploy GlusterFS server

The new lib installs a full GlusterFS cluster. It can be managed
by the service init scripts. This implementation adds the
auto-configuration for Cinder with GlusterFS

To enable GlusterFS add following to your localrc:

* enable_service glusterfs
* CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=glusterfs:glusterfs
* CINDER_GLUSTERFS_SHARES (optional)
Works on Ubuntu Trusty, Precise and Fedora 20.

Change-Id: Id8cb247164da80a0b7e1a32c9bf90928e449c281
Implements: blueprint implement-glusterfs-backend

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-06 12:03:01.000000000', 'files': ['requirements-rpm.txt'], 'message': 'requirements-rpm.txt: remove versioned dependence on avahi

cman, erlang, nagios-plugins-os-libvirt, openstack-ceilometer-common,
openstack-nova-compute, and many other packages depend on avahi-libs
version 0.6.25-12.el6_5.1 On the other hand requirements-rpm.txt insists
on using avahi-0.6.25-12, which depends on avahi-libs version 0.6.25-12.el6.
As a result avahi can not be installed along with nova (or rabbitmq)
which breaks OpenStack deployment. Therefore use unversioned dependency
on avahi

Closes-Bug: #1418913
Change-Id: Ie79bfa5631d4e06e592b54c0d38040cdcc89ffa4
'}]
commit_message:
requirements-rpm.txt: remove versioned dependence on avahi

cman, erlang, nagios-plugins-os-libvirt, openstack-ceilometer-common,
openstack-nova-compute, and many other packages depend on avahi-libs
version 0.6.25-12.el6_5.1 On the other hand requirements-rpm.txt insists
on using avahi-0.6.25-12, which depends on avahi-libs version 0.6.25-12.el6.
As a result avahi can not be installed along with nova (or rabbitmq)
which breaks OpenStack deployment. Therefore use unversioned dependency
on avahi

Closes-Bug: #1418913
Change-Id: Ie79bfa5631d4e06e592b54c0d38040cdcc89ffa4

commit_message:
Move mongodb logs to mongod.log

Enables consolidation of MongoDB logs in one location,
instead of polluting /var/log/messages.

Added rotation for /var/log/mongod.log on deployed nodes,
while the current Fuel Master rotation requires no changes.

Change-Id: I3bbc6b87ed9d125191041c310069136c59d8d1f9

commit_message:
[IBP] Fix 'device or resource busy' error in fuel-agent

In short, we've faced udev scaling issues when making a lot of `parted` calls.
As for workaround, blacklisting of rules was choisen. It helps us to mitigate
scaling issues.

The fix was stress tested on a VM with 25 disks by creating 30 partitions per
disk.

Change-Id: Ibec9c0485fba657ef592fee3aab4e7757a705e46
Closes-Bug: #1410471

commit_message:
Change oslo.utils to oslo_utils

The oslo.utils libraries are moving away from namespace packages.

This requires oslo.utils>=1.2.0

bp drop-namespace-packages

  Change fuel-devops version to 2.9.0 in requirements file.

subject: Close streamed requests explicitly
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-15 23:21:01.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/http.py', 'tests/utils.py'], 'message': "Close streamed requests explicitly

If we don't explicitly close a response after streaming its download,
then we can run into HTTPConnectionPool full warnings. It also will hurt
performance if we have to continuously create new sockets for new
responses. Calling close will return the connection to the pool so it
can be reused. Note this is only necessary when streaming a response. If
we don't stream it, then requests will return the connection to the pool
for us.

Change-Id: I803bd4dd0e769c233501d5e5ff07a19705fbe233
Closes-bug: 1341777
"}]
commit_message:
Close streamed requests explicitly

If we don't explicitly close a response after streaming its download,
then we can run into HTTPConnectionPool full warnings. It also will hurt
performance if we have to continuously create new sockets for new
responses. Calling close will return the connection to the pool so it
can be reused. Note this is only necessary when streaming a response. If
we don't stream it, then requests will return the connection to the pool
for us.

Change-Id: I803bd4dd0e769c233501d5e5ff07a19705fbe233
Closes-bug: 1341777

commit_message:
Shifting ._generate_random_name() call

In benchmark scenarios '._generate_random_name()' is called many times.
It would be better to shift the call to utils and call the method their only once.
At present I am trying this to work only for nova.
So only _boot_server() method is affected.

Change-Id: I4c3bf9ae901e03f866e1b3bfcddbcca28a2a9ac2
Closes-Bug: 1412014

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 10540, 'name': "Clayton O'Neill", 'email': 'clayton.oneill@charter.com', 'username': 'coneill'}, {'_account_id': 10622, 'name': 'SolidFire CI', 'email': 'openstack.ci@solidfire.com', 'username': 'sfci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 17:21:57.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/cinder_volume_solidfire_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/cinder_backend_solidfire_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/solidfire.pp', 'manifests/volume/solidfire.pp'], 'message': "Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name

The driver name for the SolidFire driver switched back in July of 2013:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/fd139faaf3d3fc96825bbaf3397a529e5762d92c

There was a mapping of the old driver name to the new driver name until
April 2014 which is when it was removed:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/64f71b3306f7652bee60245d62af090aaa572cf7

With the Juno release the old driver name (SolidFire) can't be used any
more and must be changed to the new one (SolidFireDriver).

(cherry picked from commit d4040c7b083a7dad91450834470acf21df449af8)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name

The driver name for the SolidFire driver switched back in July of 2013:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/fd139faaf3d3fc96825bbaf3397a529e5762d92c

There was a mapping of the old driver name to the new driver name until
April 2014 which is when it was removed:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/64f71b3306f7652bee60245d62af090aaa572cf7

With the Juno release the old driver name (SolidFire) can't be used any
more and must be changed to the new one (SolidFireDriver).

Change-Id: I5f127931b924209793f1d8fff4299b44b50291b7
(cherry picked from commit d4040c7b083a7dad91450834470acf21df449af8)

commit_message:
Be more informative when putting -2 for stable freeze

At the moment, if authors of backports are not aware of stable
maintainance policy, they are left with action items to overcome the
freeze. We should provide all the needed info to proceed with backports
for the upcoming stable release.

The text is adopted from:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StableBranch#Stable_release_managers

Change-Id: I657e7ef401c380fd6e6122a25c2eecbd63d57c24

commit_message:
Refactor the stop operation for neutron-l3-agent

* Combine the stopping of neutron-l3-agent and the stopping of metadata
processes inside namespaces into one time period (it was only for
stopping of ONE neutron l3 process).
* Some cleanups and corrections.

Change-Id: I51a706acb3b1d4d3f0e12ef07577e7852152888f
Closes-Bug: #1391881

subject: Support neutron advanced services
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-02 10:38:30.000000000', 'files': ['rcdelivery.sh', 'rccut.sh', 'upload_release.py', 'milestone.sh'], 'message': 'Support neutron advanced services

The recently split neutron-*aas need special treatment in release
scripts. The extra deliverables need to be uploaded to the same
Launchpad milestone page, and bugs should only be closed once (all
projects share the same Launchpad bug pages).

To this effect, we distinguish in the scripts the Launchpad concept
of project from the git project name as used in tarballs and skip
parts as needed. We also introduce an optional --deliverable option
to upload_release.py so that it can use different values for both.

Change-Id: I8a4db8b09a3b9d480a767ea0ce94373b4528d1a2
'}]
commit_message:
Support neutron advanced services

The recently split neutron-*aas need special treatment in release
scripts. The extra deliverables need to be uploaded to the same
Launchpad milestone page, and bugs should only be closed once (all
projects share the same Launchpad bug pages).

To this effect, we distinguish in the scripts the Launchpad concept
of project from the git project name as used in tarballs and skip
parts as needed. We also introduce an optional --deliverable option
to upload_release.py so that it can use different values for both.

Change-Id: I8a4db8b09a3b9d480a767ea0ce94373b4528d1a2

subject: Use new common specific_endpoint routines
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-03 17:52:15.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/registration.rb', 'spec/registration_spec.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': "Use new common specific_endpoint routines

Now that admin_endpoint, public_endpoint, and internal_endpoint
in the common library are working, these are the changes to use
them in the openstack-identity recipes.

This component already had different admin/internal/public
endpoints and manages them by using different names. (E.g.
'identity-admin', 'identity-internal', and 'identity-api')
This means...

1. No addition unit tests needed to be added. (No longer
   true. I went ahead and added some tests anyway.)

2. We should probably have a clean up pass at some point
   where we use the newly added infrastructure for admin,
   internal, and public endpoints for a single service
   name. This could be a disruptive change so I propose
   that we defer that clean up for now.

Change-Id: I27d0ffc5781028a450cdafcdf3db301ec3adc279
Partial-Bug: 1412919
"}]
commit_message:
Use new common specific_endpoint routines

Now that admin_endpoint, public_endpoint, and internal_endpoint
in the common library are working, these are the changes to use
them in the openstack-identity recipes.

This component already had different admin/internal/public
endpoints and manages them by using different names. (E.g.
'identity-admin', 'identity-internal', and 'identity-api')
This means...

1. No addition unit tests needed to be added. (No longer
   true. I went ahead and added some tests anyway.)

2. We should probably have a clean up pass at some point
   where we use the newly added infrastructure for admin,
   internal, and public endpoints for a single service
   name. This could be a disruptive change so I propose
   that we defer that clean up for now.

Change-Id: I27d0ffc5781028a450cdafcdf3db301ec3adc279
Partial-Bug: 1412919

commit_message:
Set locate to en_US.UTF-8 before calling puppet

When puppet is run from scripts or environments without tty it's required to
set locale as it can be empty or LC_ALL=c, though many puppet manifests
have Unicode characters.

Change-Id: I824b3212b0c258650c457dfe5e2fb5cc9f6a5a4b

Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Wait for 60 seconds on NoValidHost exception in sheduler

After schesuler starts it doesn't have data about hosts capabilities.
Let's sleep and try once more time.

Sleep for 60 seconds as a PeriodicTask interval.
Need to re-think it and do not listen creat requests before capabilities
data received. Current RPC server implementation doesn't suppor it.

Change-Id: I351d61342402b892fd4dac1efaa65b595575a39f
Closes-Bug: #1409012

subject: Enable corosync 2
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-02-04 11:01:04.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Enable corosync 2

* Enable corosync version 2 for Openstack
  infrastructure cluster
* Make pacemaker service running as a separate
  service instead of plugin

DocImpact: operations guide changes
* If Corosync service restarted, pacemaker service should
  be restarted next as well.
* Corosync 1.x cannot be upgraded to 2.x without full
  cluster downtime. All Pacemaker resources, such as Neutron
  agents, DB and AMQP clusters and others, will be hit by
  downtime as well.
* All location constraints for cloned Pacemaker resources
  must be removed as a part of Corosync version upgrade
  procedure.

related blueprint corosync-2
closes-bug: #1417972

Change-Id: I8dadd480e3b32fcdc6743e76187c224bcedffc62
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable corosync 2

* Enable corosync version 2 for Openstack
  infrastructure cluster
* Make pacemaker service running as a separate
  service instead of plugin

DocImpact: operations guide changes
* If Corosync service restarted, pacemaker service should
  be restarted next as well.
* Corosync 1.x cannot be upgraded to 2.x without full
  cluster downtime. All Pacemaker resources, such as Neutron
  agents, DB and AMQP clusters and others, will be hit by
  downtime as well.
* All location constraints for cloned Pacemaker resources
  must be removed as a part of Corosync version upgrade
  procedure.

related blueprint corosync-2
closes-bug: #1417972

Change-Id: I8dadd480e3b32fcdc6743e76187c224bcedffc62
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Structure 6.1 Release Notes

Provides a basic structure for the 6.1 Release Notes.

Content will be added/modified in separate CRs

Includes headlines for major features as understood at the this time
with links to specs for the feature; the wording of these headlines
will probably be modified and the xrefs to the specs will mostly be
replaced by links to the documentation that describes the feature.

Headlines for partner features are not included in this CR.

Change-Id: I76953d6f4bd0032b7ca8b9776ef391684b730bac

Plugins may already have DevStack support, that may need to be revised
according to the decomposition. If a plugin/driver does not have one,
it is necessary to add it to ease the development effort. This section
explains what DevStack integration options are available, in relation
to the dev/test cycle and 3rd party CI systems.

Links were not rendered correctly. So this patch takes care of that too.

Partially implements blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: Ib12e38d775af1e5a840bd009c95dac4c982b9753
'}]
commit_message:
Add section for DevStack Integration Strategies to the DevRef

Plugins may already have DevStack support, that may need to be revised
according to the decomposition. If a plugin/driver does not have one,
it is necessary to add it to ease the development effort. This section
explains what DevStack integration options are available, in relation
to the dev/test cycle and 3rd party CI systems.

Links were not rendered correctly. So this patch takes care of that too.

Partially implements blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: Ib12e38d775af1e5a840bd009c95dac4c982b9753

invalid byte sequence in US-ASCII

When updating the instance_uuid field of a node Ironic would check the
power state to see if the node was powered off, otherwise the update
would fail. This patch is removing that check and leaving it to the
drivers to ensure that the node is in whatever power state it needs to

commit_message:
Allow associate an instance independent of the node power state

When updating the instance_uuid field of a node Ironic would check the
power state to see if the node was powered off, otherwise the update
would fail. This patch is removing that check and leaving it to the
drivers to ensure that the node is in whatever power state it needs to
be as part of the deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1413296
(cherry picked from commit 7da9dd7f303660babc4f3a89a30321b94937c3cf)

Conflicts:
	ironic/conductor/manager.py

Change-Id: Ic18f49a89f18ddfa3006ba3f2ee4a22ad69c4d4d

commit_message:
Add Support for TaskFlow Executor

This patch adds support for a new task executor. This executor
leverages the taskflow library which is responsible for dispatching
the tasks.

The taskflow executor provides basic serial execution of the
tasks and uses eventlet by default. The execution mode is configurable
to have parallel execution in which case it is possible to also
configure the number of workers running at the same time.

TaskFlow wiki: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TaskFlow

partially implements bp async-glance-workers
partially implements bp taskflow-integration

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored by: Arnaud Legendre <arnaudleg@gmail.com>
Co-Authored by: Flavio Percoco <flaper87@gmail.com>
Co-Authored by: Nikhil Komawar <nikhil.komawar@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ie31e64f8fee7f9fe7336cde50d5db89577c4f76d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-28 16:09:50.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Add debug message for lvremove after udev settle

Just add a simple debug level log message for lvremove calls that
are made and successfully completed as part of error recovery.

Currently some platforms commonly receive a "Unable to deactivate"
error message when running an lvremove.  We have a retry mechanism
that performs a udevsettle and retries that in most cases results
in a succesful removal.

This patch just adds an explicit debug log message so we can track
this more easily and gather some statistical data on it.

Change-Id: I8f2480491f3cb7f078597113f967c1e285fdf105
'}]
commit_message:
Add debug message for lvremove after udev settle

Just add a simple debug level log message for lvremove calls that
are made and successfully completed as part of error recovery.

Currently some platforms commonly receive a "Unable to deactivate"
error message when running an lvremove.  We have a retry mechanism
that performs a udevsettle and retries that in most cases results
in a succesful removal.

This patch just adds an explicit debug log message so we can track
this more easily and gather some statistical data on it.

Change-Id: I8f2480491f3cb7f078597113f967c1e285fdf105

subject: Check for enabled service in d6cage
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-27 11:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['congress/harness.py', 'congress/dse/d6cage.py'], 'message': 'Check for enabled service in d6cage

Calling APIs from datasource drivers when the service is not enabled causes
exceptions. This is avoided by pre-checking the service enablement before
loading the datasource module for the service.

eg: If ceilometer is not enabled, ceilometer driver is not loaded.

Change includes a check in create service to check if the service corresponding
to the driver module being loaded is enabled by probing into keystone service
list.
Also harness is modified to first add the name of service in system_services
before calling createservice for services like "engine", "api-rule" etc.. so
that the check for service enablement is not done on these. (Obviously, there
are no services in keystone for the modules owned by the policy engine and
APIs.)
The createservice() function returns a True/False attribute before harness
tries to call initialization apis for the module like
get_schema/get_translators etc...

The datasources for which the services are not enabled are not listed for the
command "openstack congress datasource list"

Fixes Bug #1395224

Change-Id: I450ba93bcc481edf546259ffdc19920d84c827b5
'}]
commit_message:
Check for enabled service in d6cage

Calling APIs from datasource drivers when the service is not enabled causes
exceptions. This is avoided by pre-checking the service enablement before
loading the datasource module for the service.

eg: If ceilometer is not enabled, ceilometer driver is not loaded.

Change includes a check in create service to check if the service corresponding
to the driver module being loaded is enabled by probing into keystone service
list.
Also harness is modified to first add the name of service in system_services
before calling createservice for services like "engine", "api-rule" etc.. so
that the check for service enablement is not done on these. (Obviously, there
are no services in keystone for the modules owned by the policy engine and
APIs.)
The createservice() function returns a True/False attribute before harness
tries to call initialization apis for the module like
get_schema/get_translators etc...

The datasources for which the services are not enabled are not listed for the
command "openstack congress datasource list"

Fixes Bug #1395224

Change-Id: I450ba93bcc481edf546259ffdc19920d84c827b5

commit_message:
Added logging for datasource data conversion

Now if you provide some context information, the
DatasourceDriver base class will log the input/output
of its conversion process from raw data to database tables.
This is useful for debugging datasource drivers.

Change-Id: Ifc4d61230a6baba421579dbaf53d2bb991dd5a40

commit_message:
implement timestamp for Project, Role

Give a simple way to determine when Project and Role resources were
created and when they were last modified: add created_at and
updated_at attributes for Project and Role.

bp model-timestamps

commit_message:
Add info about updating db instance

User guide needs section on how to
resize db instance in dashboard.

The following commit adds the capability
to resize a database instance
(meaning assign it a new flavor) via horizon.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/108793

This commit has merged, so the doc needs
to be updated to cover this feature.

Change-Id: I37c14750353d1b4e8e0f1b4190d3f6f37adca111
Closes-Bug: #1417161
