commit_message:
Add cloud validation (cloudv) project to stackforge

Cloud validation project is going to be used for automated validation of
a deployed cloud.
The project currently contains two subprojects:
 - OSTF adapter;
 - SDN validation tool.

Change-Id: Ia6dc95d130919a61165c1460f6a279b7524e30b6

subject: Implement additional test for db migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-04 10:08:33.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/db/migrations/alembic/test_migration.py'], 'message': "Implement additional test for db migrations

Currently Manila unit tests doesn't check how many
branches exist in db migrations, but this is extremely
important, because multiple branches break
'manila db sync' command.

Implement test, which checks that db migrations has
only one branch.

Change-Id: I4125500126ba46594a636fea38480abd0c97b519
"}]
commit_message:
Implement additional test for db migrations

Currently Manila unit tests doesn't check how many
branches exist in db migrations, but this is extremely
important, because multiple branches break
'manila db sync' command.

Implement test, which checks that db migrations has
only one branch.

Change-Id: I4125500126ba46594a636fea38480abd0c97b519

This causes agent_ssh to not be run against Ironic patches for
stable/juno. The job was not yet working when Juno was released, however
has been fixed and made voting since.

Alternatively, we can fix Juno devstack to make this job pass. This

commit_message:
Make agent_ssh job not run on stable/juno Ironic patches

This causes agent_ssh to not be run against Ironic patches for
stable/juno. The job was not yet working when Juno was released, however
has been fixed and made voting since.

Alternatively, we can fix Juno devstack to make this job pass. This
patch begins that process: Ieec8cc64e504b04a21daa49e90e2d4925f4838ee

Change-Id: Ia9f3936a836ed756e03761b75a1f471e9cd501d3

commit_message:
Move puppet-tripleo to Stackforge

puppet-tripleo is the lightweight composition layer for puppet TripleO.
It needs to reside closes to TripleO Heat templates and TripleO Puppet
elements.

This module will be composed of some roles (i.e. loadbalancer) consumed
by Heat templates to setup a TripleO setup.

Change-Id: I0c12b7063a3c34448ea1ca666ef735e24d87f15b

commit_message:
GlusterFS: passthrough devstack config

This patch provides the glusterfs devstack configuration through
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG variable, rather than having devstack-gate
need to know about devstack glusterfs plugin.

Change-Id: I8150d54c1100814ca40e9f6471fd4e979d199967

subject: Update chef-rake jobs to use chefdk and run on trusty
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-04 08:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/chef-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Update chef-rake jobs to use chefdk and run on trusty

* added macro for installing chefdk (currently with version 0.4.0-1
  since chef does not provide a 'latest' link)
* switched from using ruby-191-prep in gate-{name}-chef-rake job to installing
  chefdk which should include the whole environment needed
* changed chef-rake-test builder to execute rake inside of the chefdk
  environment (test is omitted, since its the default job)
* removed the pin on precise for the gate-{name}-chef-rake job to use
  the current default trusty instead

Change-Id: I09e7465068d467395aafccd2de027000a1ec4143
"}]
commit_message:
Update chef-rake jobs to use chefdk and run on trusty

* added macro for installing chefdk (currently with version 0.4.0-1
  since chef does not provide a 'latest' link)
* switched from using ruby-191-prep in gate-{name}-chef-rake job to installing
  chefdk which should include the whole environment needed
* changed chef-rake-test builder to execute rake inside of the chefdk
  environment (test is omitted, since its the default job)
* removed the pin on precise for the gate-{name}-chef-rake job to use
  the current default trusty instead

Change-Id: I09e7465068d467395aafccd2de027000a1ec4143

commit_message:
Move extra routes processing to router classes

Move legacy and HA routers implementation of the extra
routes extension to their respective router classes.
Move the unit tests as well.

subject: Just directly access the callback attributes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 06:35:07.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/periodic.py'], 'message': "Just directly access the callback attributes

Since we perform validation on the callbacks
in the constructor we don't need to continue being
cautious after that point so we can remove the
usage of getattr and just access the underlying
callback properties that must have already existed.

Change-Id: I0c86506488d139268cb30f6c346484b2e978697f
"}]
commit_message:
Just directly access the callback attributes

Since we perform validation on the callbacks
in the constructor we don't need to continue being
cautious after that point so we can remove the
usage of getattr and just access the underlying
callback properties that must have already existed.

Change-Id: I0c86506488d139268cb30f6c346484b2e978697f

commit_message:
Revise Read-only volumes section

The commands introduced in Read-only volumes in emc-vnx-direct-driver.xml
are incorrect.

Replace them with 'cinder readonly-mode-update volume True'

Change-Id: I928b07cfc96545ab830b228103e91aae46ede0a7

commit_message:
Move functional tests to keystone/tests/functional

This commit moves Keystone's functional tests to it's own directory and
adds a tox environment for running only functional tests. Keystone
functional tests can now be run with:

  $ tox -e functional

New functional tests for Keystone should be added to the
keystone/tests/functional/ directory.

Change-Id: I799090a2c2beb0ee68cf39fc06f9ddce2b7fa40f

commit_message:
Remove --skip-redirect form the tgtd service restart

skip-redirect was intruduced with the first commit related
to cinder support, nobody remembers why was this undocumented option
there those times.

Two sections of the hypervisor support matrix refer readers to the
sections of the document dealing with the "pause" operation.
Although there is a section in the raw .ini file called
"[operation.pause]", this doesn't appear at all in the rendered
version of document since it's title is set to
"Stop instance CPUs".  This renders readers of the rendered
document unable to find sections being referenced.

This patch clears up the confusion by changing the references
to refer to "Stop instance CPUs" rather than "pause".

Change-Id: Ia97d8e400db3a11291a715f6a630ea8bc638993e
Closes-bug: #1418641
'}]
commit_message:
Fix references to non-existent "pause" section

Two sections of the hypervisor support matrix refer readers to the
sections of the document dealing with the "pause" operation.
Although there is a section in the raw .ini file called
"[operation.pause]", this doesn't appear at all in the rendered
version of document since it's title is set to
"Stop instance CPUs".  This renders readers of the rendered
document unable to find sections being referenced.

This patch clears up the confusion by changing the references
to refer to "Stop instance CPUs" rather than "pause".

Change-Id: Ia97d8e400db3a11291a715f6a630ea8bc638993e
Closes-bug: #1418641

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-28 19:42:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': 'Create SolidFire Template account on init

The standard flow in the SolidFire volume is to create
accounts dynamically as needed based on project id.
Unfortunately the clone_image method "forgot" about this
detail and calls the private clone_volume method without
a valid account resulting in an AccountNotFound
Exception.

The clone_image method is enabled using a specific account
provided via the configuration file.  Rather than worry
about dynamic account creation on clone_image call, this
patch just makes it part of the init phase.  We check to
see if template caching is enabled and if it is, just
go ahead and check/create the account on startup.

Change-Id: I41a8d400d3dfc0e185304f80efd419ebac9efdf6
Closes-Bug: #1414760
'}]
commit_message:
Create SolidFire Template account on init

The standard flow in the SolidFire volume is to create
accounts dynamically as needed based on project id.
Unfortunately the clone_image method "forgot" about this
detail and calls the private clone_volume method without
a valid account resulting in an AccountNotFound
Exception.

The clone_image method is enabled using a specific account
provided via the configuration file.  Rather than worry
about dynamic account creation on clone_image call, this
patch just makes it part of the init phase.  We check to
see if template caching is enabled and if it is, just
go ahead and check/create the account on startup.

Change-Id: I41a8d400d3dfc0e185304f80efd419ebac9efdf6
Closes-Bug: #1414760

commit_message:
Fix argument order in assertEqual: tests/test_nfs.py

The assertEqual in cinder/tests/test_nfs.py is using
incorrect argument order (observed, expected), which causes the
error message about mismatch to be reversed if the test case fails.
Change it to (expected, observed).

Change-Id: I7fec2e5df91369c3cae2adef3189e8bd86fe4480
Partial-Bug: #1259292

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-02 19:50:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py', 'etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters', 'cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_lvm.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Enable use of an /etc/cinder/lvm.conf file

During tempest and Rally runs we've noticed occasional
LVM command hangs (lvs, vgs and pvs), we've also gathered
enough data to show that we see very slow response times from
these commands almost all of the time.

It turns out that this seems to be an issue with us scanning
all devices during LVM operations, including devices that may
be Cinder Volumes that are attaching and detaching from the system.

Inspecting a run instrumented with strace shows a number of LVM
commands timing out due to the device being scanned being removed
during scan, and the LVM command in turn waiting until it times out
on the scan that's in process.

This patch just adds the ability to setup a lvm.conf file in
/etc/cinder.  The Cinder LVM code will now specifically set
the LVM_SYSTEM_DIR environment variable to that directory for
each of the LVM scan commands in brick/local_dev/lvm.py.
If the system doesn't have the file, we use the empty string
which tells LVM to use it's defaults.  This only affects LVM
commands in Cinder, the idea is to ensure we don't impact any
other LVM operations on the node outside of Cinder and that we
behave as we always have in the case of no lvm.conf file being
setup in /etc/cinder.  The presence of the file is auto-detected
on brick/localdev/lvm init.

We'll update the OpenStack Devstack deployment scripts to put this
together and fix things up there first. Until that's done and until
we auto-generate the conf (or document it well), this will be a
*partial* bugfix.

I considered adding a default lvm.conf file to cinder/etc/<sample>
that would be copied in on install, but decided against this to
avoid any possible issues with compatability issues between
platforms or versions.

To use, just copy the /etc/lvm/lvm.conf file to /etc/cinder and
modify the filter as appropriate, for example:
  To use loopback device only:
    filter = [ "a/loop/", "r/.*/" ]
  If you have a physical drive like /dev/sdb1
    filter = [ "a/dev/sdb1/", "r/.*/" ]

Finally, this patch also goes through and cleans up our cmd
variables in brick/localdev/lvm.  We had a mix of using a
cmd array, and strings; this causes inconsistencies and makes
it difficult to extend or modify commands.  Switch everything to
using an array and use extend to provide the correct prefix.

Need to update docs to include a recommendation to create an
/etc/cinder/lvm.conf file and set device filters appropriately.
Doc-Impact
Partial-Bug: #1373513

Change-Id: Ia2289197a6d7fcfc910ee3de48e0a2173881a1e6
'}]
commit_message:
Enable use of an /etc/cinder/lvm.conf file

During tempest and Rally runs we've noticed occasional
LVM command hangs (lvs, vgs and pvs), we've also gathered
enough data to show that we see very slow response times from
these commands almost all of the time.

It turns out that this seems to be an issue with us scanning
all devices during LVM operations, including devices that may
be Cinder Volumes that are attaching and detaching from the system.

Inspecting a run instrumented with strace shows a number of LVM
commands timing out due to the device being scanned being removed
during scan, and the LVM command in turn waiting until it times out
on the scan that's in process.

This patch just adds the ability to setup a lvm.conf file in
/etc/cinder.  The Cinder LVM code will now specifically set
the LVM_SYSTEM_DIR environment variable to that directory for
each of the LVM scan commands in brick/local_dev/lvm.py.
If the system doesn't have the file, we use the empty string
which tells LVM to use it's defaults.  This only affects LVM
commands in Cinder, the idea is to ensure we don't impact any
other LVM operations on the node outside of Cinder and that we
behave as we always have in the case of no lvm.conf file being
setup in /etc/cinder.  The presence of the file is auto-detected
on brick/localdev/lvm init.

We'll update the OpenStack Devstack deployment scripts to put this
together and fix things up there first. Until that's done and until
we auto-generate the conf (or document it well), this will be a
*partial* bugfix.

I considered adding a default lvm.conf file to cinder/etc/<sample>
that would be copied in on install, but decided against this to
avoid any possible issues with compatability issues between
platforms or versions.

To use, just copy the /etc/lvm/lvm.conf file to /etc/cinder and
modify the filter as appropriate, for example:
  To use loopback device only:
    filter = [ "a/loop/", "r/.*/" ]
  If you have a physical drive like /dev/sdb1
    filter = [ "a/dev/sdb1/", "r/.*/" ]

Finally, this patch also goes through and cleans up our cmd
variables in brick/localdev/lvm.  We had a mix of using a
cmd array, and strings; this causes inconsistencies and makes
it difficult to extend or modify commands.  Switch everything to
using an array and use extend to provide the correct prefix.

Need to update docs to include a recommendation to create an
/etc/cinder/lvm.conf file and set device filters appropriately.
Doc-Impact
Partial-Bug: #1373513

Change-Id: Ia2289197a6d7fcfc910ee3de48e0a2173881a1e6

commit_message:
Restore and fix vmware unit tests

This patch actually restores vmware unit tests, by adding back
the __init__.py file which was renamed during the advanced
service spinoff and not reinstated when fixing vmware code to
comply with the spinoff.

Furthermore, this patch also fixes a minor issue with context
usage in vmware unit tests which is triggering failures because
of the new database constraint introduced with the commit
79c97120de9cff4d0992b5d41ff4bbf05e890f89

Finally, flake8 tests on vmware directories are also restored
with this patch.

Change-Id: Ib63463fca28bbb4a1eb60b8f5f4b63b3d3367c9e
Closes-Bug: #1416593
Closes-Bug: #1416596

subject: Allow to find resource with digit name
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-12-24 03:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/tests/v2/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/tests/v1/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_types.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volume_types.py', 'cinderclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Allow to find resource with digit name

Initially, when we are trying to create a
volume by the name of numbers [0011] then
volume is created with that name but when
we are trying to delete/show this volume
then " Not Found (HTTP 404) " error occurs.
because method 'find_resource' taking digit
name as id.

Now by adding 'is_alphanum_id_allowed'
attribute to manager, alphanum id will allow
for the resource. With this patch we will be
able to delete the volume what we created.

Change-Id: Ib4dfaa9f15961fadc1a322bcf57f636e0f28fecf
Closes-bug: #1398814
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to find resource with digit name

Initially, when we are trying to create a
volume by the name of numbers [0011] then
volume is created with that name but when
we are trying to delete/show this volume
then " Not Found (HTTP 404) " error occurs.
because method 'find_resource' taking digit
name as id.

Now by adding 'is_alphanum_id_allowed'
attribute to manager, alphanum id will allow
for the resource. With this patch we will be
able to delete the volume what we created.

Change-Id: Ib4dfaa9f15961fadc1a322bcf57f636e0f28fecf
Closes-bug: #1398814

commit_message:
Do not create floating-ip-bulk when not existing pool is set

Initially, when create floating-ip-bulk with not
existing 'pool' option, no exception is raise
and floating-ip-bulk can be created
successfully.

Now, this patch makes it return 400 to client.

Change-Id: Ia28e611acf1288243594db3c9cf9ac89996ef5be
Closes-Bug: #1377072

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-05 23:10:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/test_firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/drivers/varmour/test_varmour_fwaas.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/varmour/varmour_router.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/varmour/test_varmour_router.py'], 'message': 'Pass root_helper to ip_lib by keyword argument to prep for removal

To assist in being able to stop passing the root_helper option to
various classes/functions and instead handle root_helper just in
execute(), pass root_helper in advanced services via keyword
argument, so that the root_helper removal patch will be able to
accept, but ignore it and still have tests pass.

Change-Id: Icb9d638cf4215ec3be71cfa4fac9ca7781e6221c
'}]
commit_message:
Pass root_helper to ip_lib by keyword argument to prep for removal

To assist in being able to stop passing the root_helper option to
various classes/functions and instead handle root_helper just in
execute(), pass root_helper in advanced services via keyword
argument, so that the root_helper removal patch will be able to
accept, but ignore it and still have tests pass.

Change-Id: Icb9d638cf4215ec3be71cfa4fac9ca7781e6221c

instance. This patch invoke cleanup_instance_network_on_host when unshelve

Closes-Bug: #1350704
"}]
commit_message:
Update network resource when shelve offload instance

Commit: 4f8185549dfe11eb1ce405711593baa1528045ea fixes the problem
by invoke migrate_instance_finish function. But that function should
be used by only for migration case. This patch use the new network api
'setup_instance_network_on_host' to update network for instance.

Also for nova-network, floating-ip should cleanup when unshelve offload
instance. This patch invoke cleanup_instance_network_on_host when unshelve
offload instance.

Change-Id: I75df695ec7b14ebaa25f384ba9a0697a179af03a
Closes-Bug: #1350704

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 8959, 'name': 'Lakshmi N Sampath', 'email': 'lakshmi.sampath@hp.com', 'username': 'lakshmi'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-22 21:56:56.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/software-metadefs.rst'], 'message': 'Software Metadata Definitions

The spec will provide a base library of metadata definitions for
various common software products, components, and libraries that
may exist on particular image (or volume or instance). These
metadata definitions will make it easier for end users and
admins to easily describe the software and its properties.
This information will enable an improved and faster user
experience for applying software metadata, searching based
on software metadata, and viewing the software information
about an image.

Various improvements in horizon are underway to take
advantage of this metadata. For example, a user launching
an instance will be able to expand the image row to see
additional information about the image.  This will include
providing the metadata definition for properties on the image.
This same information will also be visible from the image and
instance details page.

Implements: blueprint software-metadefs
Change-Id: I70c13d1c903ef4b447eaaeb4c3af40a4cbfb3c71
'}]
commit_message:
Software Metadata Definitions

The spec will provide a base library of metadata definitions for
various common software products, components, and libraries that
may exist on particular image (or volume or instance). These
metadata definitions will make it easier for end users and
admins to easily describe the software and its properties.
This information will enable an improved and faster user
experience for applying software metadata, searching based
on software metadata, and viewing the software information
about an image.

Various improvements in horizon are underway to take
advantage of this metadata. For example, a user launching
an instance will be able to expand the image row to see
additional information about the image.  This will include
providing the metadata definition for properties on the image.
This same information will also be visible from the image and
instance details page.

Implements: blueprint software-metadefs
Change-Id: I70c13d1c903ef4b447eaaeb4c3af40a4cbfb3c71

commit_message:
use precise marker function for log message translation

According to guidelines http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
we can/should use _LI, _LW, _LE, _LC for different log level messages
to lower translation burden.

This patch adds hacking checks to follow i18n's guide, and fixes some
string interpolation issues for log messages.

Change-Id: I9a9f87c78670150df75919be9e0e5669b296cb30

commit_message:
Create a reusable angular-based wizard

Motivation:
The initial driving motivation is to redesign the launch instance wizard
based on a modern, responsive design that is based on client side
rendering using angular.

Description:
The wizard will be as lightweight as possible, but still allow for
customizable text, localization, customizable per-worfklow number of
steps.

Design:
* Angular-based.
* Using Angular Bootstrap UI modal widget.

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>
Implements: blueprint initial-reusable-angular-wizard
Change-Id: I6d7530b6723764d3ca117e16eeae78c0ab35e48e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-26 10:04:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/swift.yaml'], 'message': 'Install test-requirements for swiftclient functional tests

The functional test for python-swiftclient currently fails all the time because
an required package for testing (testrepository) is missing.

swift itself uses nosetest to start functional tests, but python-swiftclient
uses testr and thus requires the package testrepository to be installed.

This patch simply installs all requirements for the tests. I was able to
reproduce this error localy using a fresh virtualenv environment, and this
patch fixed it for me.

Change-Id: I5417f74d324b1915155e321c3a87138069aa35fa
'}]
commit_message:
Install test-requirements for swiftclient functional tests

The functional test for python-swiftclient currently fails all the time because
an required package for testing (testrepository) is missing.

swift itself uses nosetest to start functional tests, but python-swiftclient
uses testr and thus requires the package testrepository to be installed.

This patch simply installs all requirements for the tests. I was able to
reproduce this error localy using a fresh virtualenv environment, and this
patch fixed it for me.

Change-Id: I5417f74d324b1915155e321c3a87138069aa35fa

commit_message:
Allow Tempest to install and configure for the Neutron API job

Related patch [1] adds a variable to let Tempest install and configure
but skip the test execution. This is particularly useful for the Neutron
API job, that does rely on Tempest, but does not need Tempest to run
the tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148052/

commit_message:
Jenkins/Puppet: increase timeout to 60 minutes

Instead of 30, increase the timeout to 60 minutes for unit &
functionnal testing in Puppet jobs.

The reason is because some modules have a lot of tests, and it takes
more than 30 minutes.

Change-Id: Ib3d71242cf52899ee64d75bb357c571d85496d50

commit_message:
Revert "make req_ref doesn't require id"

This reverts commit d1bad7674b03a6c37ee1bf5cac68c15e3f10c1b2.

The object returned by the server should typically have an
"id" field, but this change makes it so that there's no "id"
field in the server response. So now the simulated response
doesn't match the expected server response.

Change-Id: Iabb13539c379bb4250ac0622795d7352eda50828

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-02 22:36:59.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Uncap boto now that nova commit f7b1af9e1 is merged

We originally tried to uncap this in nova in that change but we can't
update nova's requirements outside of global-requirements, but we did
confirm that it fixes the problem with the latest boto so we can uncap

commit_message:
Uncap boto now that nova commit f7b1af9e1 is merged

We originally tried to uncap this in nova in that change but we can't
update nova's requirements outside of global-requirements, but we did
confirm that it fixes the problem with the latest boto so we can uncap
the version constraint now.

Related-Bug: #1410622

Change-Id: Ide222477e9c14c42edca52d111cb49c43eed7feb

commit_message:
Drop old namespace for some oslo libraries

The oslo team has decided to drop the "oslo." namespacing as it was
causing a lot of trouble. So, as described [1], the namespace was
dropped in favor of the "oslo_" imports that will be used.

Note that oslo.messaging still doesn't have a release supporting their
switch to oslo_messaging, but it will come in their next release. So I
will do the switch when they have it ready.

[1] http://blog.nemebean.com/content/whys-and-hows-oslo-namespace-change

Change-Id: I4743598668d9dde540275911467b94386bad0983

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-02-03 15:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Ironic: Adds config drive support

This patch is adding config drive v2 support for the Ironic drive. As
attaching a volume in a baremetal instance is not as simple as VMs and
also hardware depedent, this patch will base64 + gzip the generated
configdrive and pass it to Ironic as a string, Ironic then can take
care about storing and exposing it to the the tenant of baremetal.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint use-configdrive-with-ironic
Change-Id: Ibc745e9a63bc3d5d68217020b3d591f71c3f8a96
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Adds config drive support

This patch is adding config drive v2 support for the Ironic drive. As
attaching a volume in a baremetal instance is not as simple as VMs and
also hardware depedent, this patch will base64 + gzip the generated
configdrive and pass it to Ironic as a string, Ironic then can take
care about storing and exposing it to the the tenant of baremetal.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint use-configdrive-with-ironic
Change-Id: Ibc745e9a63bc3d5d68217020b3d591f71c3f8a96

commit_message:
Eliminate shell param from subprocesses in tests

Of the calls to execute a subprocess performed in tests, none of them
require a shell. Test utility method was modified to not use a shell,
eliminating a discouraged practice.

Change-Id: If2571ee8f4ea2fdf6e14416d5abe5de275d3a1c4
Closes-Bug: 1348416

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 06:04:14.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check_valid_gerrit_config.sh'], 'message': "check_valid_gerrit_config: Portability improvements

* Avoid hardcoding a full path of mktemp command.
  For some platforms it might be /usr/bin/mktemp.
  eg. NetBSD, OS X

* For some platforms mktemp -d requires a template specified.
  eg. OS X

* sh is more available than bash.  Fortunately we don't actually
  rely on bash specific features here.

Change-Id: I92eaee39daae90d13ad4544f3fc7dc4342834d49
"}]
commit_message:
check_valid_gerrit_config: Portability improvements

* Avoid hardcoding a full path of mktemp command.
  For some platforms it might be /usr/bin/mktemp.
  eg. NetBSD, OS X

* For some platforms mktemp -d requires a template specified.
  eg. OS X

* sh is more available than bash.  Fortunately we don't actually
  rely on bash specific features here.

Change-Id: I92eaee39daae90d13ad4544f3fc7dc4342834d49

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 06:04:14.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check_projects_yaml_alphabetized.sh'], 'message': "check_projects_yaml_alphabetized: Portability improvements

* For some platforms sort doesn't have --ignore-case.
  eg. NetBSD
  Use the short-name equivalent instead.

* Avoid hardcoding a full path of mktemp command.
  For some platforms it might be /usr/bin/mktemp.
  eg. NetBSD, OS X

* For some platforms mktemp -d requires a template specified.
  eg. OS X

* sh is more available than bash.  Fortunately we don't actually
  rely on bash specific features here.

Change-Id: Iafdd9b763e9aa3afe1f94b93f4aa0152631202fb
"}]
commit_message:
check_projects_yaml_alphabetized: Portability improvements

* For some platforms sort doesn't have --ignore-case.
  eg. NetBSD
  Use the short-name equivalent instead.

* Avoid hardcoding a full path of mktemp command.
  For some platforms it might be /usr/bin/mktemp.
  eg. NetBSD, OS X

* For some platforms mktemp -d requires a template specified.
  eg. OS X

* sh is more available than bash.  Fortunately we don't actually
  rely on bash specific features here.

Change-Id: Iafdd9b763e9aa3afe1f94b93f4aa0152631202fb

commit_message:
libvirt: fix console device for system z for log file

The system z platform needs a console device for the log file of an
instance. A (manual) regression test showed that this is not the case
with master from 2015-01-22. The guest.cpu.arch is 'None' which leads
to the creation of a wrong device. The bug was introduced with commit
11a2ed096

This fix uses the libvirt utils to decide which architecture has to be
considered.

Closes-bug: 1414038

Change-Id: I97dc55e6fca0b2491d4a9bc81366f9c92d39002a

subject: Fix for CooperativeReader to process read length
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11356, 'name': 'Louis Taylor', 'email': 'louis@kragniz.eu', 'username': 'kragniz'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 11864, 'name': 'Ben Roble', 'email': 'ben.roble@rackspace.com', 'username': 'broble'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-05 11:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'glance/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix for CooperativeReader to process read length

CooperativeReader, being an eventlet-friendly wrapper around the
generator- based reader of image data, actually transforms
chunk-by-chunk iteration into the readable stream. It is used when the
image is being copied from the remote source: some generator-based
image data representing the remote source acts as its underlying
object, and the instance of CooperativeReader is passed as a data
stream to the backend client which uses it to read the data.

Before this patch, the CooperativeReader was ignoring the "length"
parameter of the read method, always returning the whole chunk returned
by the underlying generator (in case of HTTP source the size of this
chunk is 16 M). This was causing problems for the clients attempting to
read data from it, and - under some circumstances - the loss of data.

For chunked storage of files in Swift a special class (ChunkReader,
declared in the swift store driver) is used to reduce the requested
read length so no extra data is read and transferred. However, this was
not working as the CooperativeReader (which was the underlying stream
for the ChunkReader) was ignoring the requested size. This was causing
the data to be lost when reading behind the boundaries of the Chunks.

This patchset introduces a buffer in the CooperativeReader to store the
most recently fetched iterator chunk. The reads are independent from
requests to iterator, so the CooperativeReader is able to return the
exact requested amount of bytes and no data is lost due to extra-reads.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ief37d1e29487bb03e612320f5cc06910cfd1c23a
Closes-bug: #1412802
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for CooperativeReader to process read length

CooperativeReader, being an eventlet-friendly wrapper around the
generator- based reader of image data, actually transforms
chunk-by-chunk iteration into the readable stream. It is used when the
image is being copied from the remote source: some generator-based
image data representing the remote source acts as its underlying
object, and the instance of CooperativeReader is passed as a data
stream to the backend client which uses it to read the data.

Before this patch, the CooperativeReader was ignoring the "length"
parameter of the read method, always returning the whole chunk returned
by the underlying generator (in case of HTTP source the size of this
chunk is 16 M). This was causing problems for the clients attempting to
read data from it, and - under some circumstances - the loss of data.

For chunked storage of files in Swift a special class (ChunkReader,
declared in the swift store driver) is used to reduce the requested
read length so no extra data is read and transferred. However, this was
not working as the CooperativeReader (which was the underlying stream
for the ChunkReader) was ignoring the requested size. This was causing
the data to be lost when reading behind the boundaries of the Chunks.

This patchset introduces a buffer in the CooperativeReader to store the
most recently fetched iterator chunk. The reads are independent from
requests to iterator, so the CooperativeReader is able to return the
exact requested amount of bytes and no data is lost due to extra-reads.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ief37d1e29487bb03e612320f5cc06910cfd1c23a
Closes-bug: #1412802

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirement

Since Glance dropped support for Python 2.6 and argparse is native in
Python >= 2.7, there's no need to pip install it.

Change-Id: Ica8a7215debd6f47555451f67a76f929c8b0e62e

commit_message:
Prepare for ability to set PowerVM uuid value

Make the current uuid cache a singleton method so we do not
need to pass it around.  In the future, we should be able
to map from an OpenStack uuid to a PowerVM uuid.

Change-Id: I2be72cfb5ef3a03087db6c98062eccfa7ce23a78

commit_message:
[Sahara] Support Cinder availability zones

Add an optional field in the node group template page. It is used for
selecting the availability zone where to create volumes.

Change-Id: I94a92425884fe0611b9bf7439030bd226b25f72c
Implements: blueprint support-cinder-availability-zones

subject: Refactor federation SQL backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 08:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/federation/backends/sql.py'], 'message': 'Refactor federation SQL backend

- Move non database related operation out of the transaction
- Use with sql.transaction() as session to open new db transactions
- Remove unnecessary session = sql.get_session() line from SP operation.

Change-Id: I5ae70268e25b0ec58c7e9328fba4507611e1242e
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor federation SQL backend

- Move non database related operation out of the transaction
- Use with sql.transaction() as session to open new db transactions
- Remove unnecessary session = sql.get_session() line from SP operation.

Change-Id: I5ae70268e25b0ec58c7e9328fba4507611e1242e

commit_message:
Puppet documentation updates

This patch updates the puppet documentation per our recent
switch to using packages installed by DIB. These instructions
should now help users to install packages at image build
time or deployment time, whichever they choose.

Change-Id: I5bfab681ea4073112aca9df7f69cf9c3db275236

commit_message:
Force recreate puppet module symlinks

It's useful for this script to be re-runnable when developing locally
and for things like applying elements via instack. Force recreating the
symlinks shouldn't have any ill effect.

Change-Id: Ia2f45824a6f53853f8d2bd1d2d901170b910f1ec

subject: Return useful message when name is not unique
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 17:24:47.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/v1/pipeline.py', 'solumclient/v1/component.py', 'solumclient/v1/plan.py', 'solumclient/common/exc.py', 'solumclient/v1/assembly.py'], 'message': "Return useful message when name is not unique

Catch NoUniqueMatch exceptions and return a
clear error message when a user attempts
'solum X get Y' for any resource X of (assembly,
component, plan, or pipeline), and any name Y
that is not unique of the instances of the requested
resource.

Change-Id: I4bb0be8fb28598198ad20cd57bf05f11dc21bc51
"}]
commit_message:
Return useful message when name is not unique

Catch NoUniqueMatch exceptions and return a
clear error message when a user attempts
'solum X get Y' for any resource X of (assembly,
component, plan, or pipeline), and any name Y
that is not unique of the instances of the requested
resource.

Change-Id: I4bb0be8fb28598198ad20cd57bf05f11dc21bc51

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-05 02:59:59.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Support region_name for Heat

In environments with more than one region, heat will just pick the first
endpoints it sees in the catalog unless the region is specified. This
allows the ability to tell Heat which region to use

Change-Id: I795315fee8955d9c1c29e273852f6dad3b777019
'}]
commit_message:
Support region_name for Heat

In environments with more than one region, heat will just pick the first
endpoints it sees in the catalog unless the region is specified. This
allows the ability to tell Heat which region to use

Change-Id: I795315fee8955d9c1c29e273852f6dad3b777019

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-05 12:32:44.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/root.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/base.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/root.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/alarms.py'], 'message': "Use stevedore to load alarm rules api

Alarm rule evaluators are loadable with stevedore, but not the API side,
since wsme 0.6 it's now possible to do it.

This change adds that to allow to create a gnocchi alarm rule api and
evaluator in the gnocchi code tree.

This also move out the V2Controller API from __init__ to avoid
recursive import with stevedore.

Change-Id: I468f9f82b41eb7f4896dd93a8c62ce63b49535bb
"}]
commit_message:
Use stevedore to load alarm rules api

Alarm rule evaluators are loadable with stevedore, but not the API side,
since wsme 0.6 it's now possible to do it.

This change adds that to allow to create a gnocchi alarm rule api and
evaluator in the gnocchi code tree.

This also move out the V2Controller API from __init__ to avoid
recursive import with stevedore.

commit_message:
Search for nova-network host only with nova-network

Search for network host only with nova-network enabled
Otherwise, you will get an empty list and OSTF test will
fail

Change-Id: I1b7cb2965824e57c4421d9825550153f8cfe255a
Closes-bug: #1418703

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 09:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Cap pycadf to 0.5.1

pycadf release 0.6.0 bumped the minimum for oslo.messaging to 1.4.0
causing nova-manage to die when only 1.3.1 was found.

Closes-bug: #1418422

Change-Id: Ic430110991d7e2a4a216ce0a3c20c5ae411faa58
'}]
commit_message:
Cap pycadf to 0.5.1

pycadf release 0.6.0 bumped the minimum for oslo.messaging to 1.4.0
causing nova-manage to die when only 1.3.1 was found.

Closes-bug: #1418422

Change-Id: Ic430110991d7e2a4a216ce0a3c20c5ae411faa58

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-05 04:42:50.000000000', 'files': ['thirdparty-requirements.txt', 'congress/datasources/cloudfoundryv2_driver.py', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_cloudfoundryv2_driver.py', 'etc/datasources.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Add cloudfoundry datasource driver

This patch adds a datasource driver to congress that integrates with
cloudfoundry. This driver exports the following tables with cloudfoundry
data: organizations, apps, spaces.

Implements blueprint: cloudfoundry-datasource-driver

Change-Id: I632fbf95f6a24ec975448aaa4929fa8a290c3cc3
Co-authored-by: Sabha Parameswaran <sabhap@pivotal.io>
'}]
commit_message:
Add cloudfoundry datasource driver

This patch adds a datasource driver to congress that integrates with
cloudfoundry. This driver exports the following tables with cloudfoundry
data: organizations, apps, spaces.

Implements blueprint: cloudfoundry-datasource-driver

Change-Id: I632fbf95f6a24ec975448aaa4929fa8a290c3cc3
Co-authored-by: Sabha Parameswaran <sabhap@pivotal.io>

commit_message:
Using oslo_* instead of oslo.*

Changes:
* using oslo_config instead of oslo.config
* using oslo_concurrency instead of oslo.concurrency
* using oslo_db instead of oslo.db
* using oslo_i18n instead of oslo.i18n
* using oslo_messaging instead of oslo.messaging
* using oslo_middleware instead of oslo.middleware
* using oslo_serialization instead of oslo.serialization
* using oslo_utils instead of oslo.utils

Change-Id: Ib0f18603ca5b0885256a39a96a3620d05260a272
Closes-bug: #1414587

subject: puppet: Add EnablePackageInstall option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-05 15:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['swift-storage-puppet.yaml', 'cinder-storage-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/overcloud_volume.pp', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/overcloud_object.pp', 'puppet/ringbuilder.pp', 'puppet/overcloud_controller.pp', 'compute-puppet.yaml', 'controller-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/loadbalancer.pp', 'puppet/overcloud_compute.pp'], 'message': "puppet: Add EnablePackageInstall option

This adds an option which enables package installation via
Yum when Puppet executes. Users might want to disable Yum
installation of packages via puppet when using pre-installed
images.

The option is off by default: meaning that Puppet will no
longer install packages by default. Users will need to
enable the EnablePackageInstall in order to get
the previous behavior.

The intent is to use the default_parameters section
of the Heat environment to allow users to cleanly enable this
features without wiring it into the top level. This is because
the new parameter is Puppet specific and doesn't really apply to
other implementations. Kilo Heat already has support for
default_parameters and so does python-heatclient.

NOTE: most TripleO users do not yet have the heatclient
features because setup-clienttools in tripleo-incubator only installs
releases via pip. It is for these reasons the default_parameters
section in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml is commented out
for now.

Change-Id: I3af71b801b87d080b367d9e4a1fb44c1bfea6e87
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: Add EnablePackageInstall option

This adds an option which enables package installation via
Yum when Puppet executes. Users might want to disable Yum
installation of packages via puppet when using pre-installed
images.

The option is off by default: meaning that Puppet will no
longer install packages by default. Users will need to
enable the EnablePackageInstall in order to get
the previous behavior.

The intent is to use the default_parameters section
of the Heat environment to allow users to cleanly enable this
features without wiring it into the top level. This is because
the new parameter is Puppet specific and doesn't really apply to
other implementations. Kilo Heat already has support for
default_parameters and so does python-heatclient.

NOTE: most TripleO users do not yet have the heatclient
features because setup-clienttools in tripleo-incubator only installs
releases via pip. It is for these reasons the default_parameters
section in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml is commented out
for now.

Change-Id: I3af71b801b87d080b367d9e4a1fb44c1bfea6e87

Configures namespace deletion

Add option to the L3 and DHCP agent configuration to
enable automatic deletion of router and DHCP namespaces
when the router or network is deleted.

Closes-Bug: 1404941
(cherry picked from commit 09e0ef8958b1b893cf82cf35366733d2ece132ba)

commit_message:
Reseller

With this implementation, we'll cover the Reseller Use case
where one will be able to resell a project that behaves like
a domain, where we can create users, roles and groups.

Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Brito <andrey@dsc.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: bp reseller

Change-Id: I52509d08a945653b9d692022f1df0e59f6407f8f

commit_message:
Make params order fixed in stack forms

Horizon input fields may be swapped when launching stack instances
with some errors. The patch make params order fixed by simply sort
them.

Change-Id: Ied3e681cfa76a52bde824ddc91ff3c1851b3cac3
Closes-Bug: #1417515

ceilometer 'hardware' metering. This rely's on the

subject: Puppet: wire in neutron_dnsmasq_options
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-04 14:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Puppet: wire in neutron_dnsmasq_options

This patch updates puppet on the controller so that it
configures the Neutron dnsmasq options file data with
the value provided by the Heat NeutronDnsmasqOptions
parameter.

Properly configuring this setting can help resolve/tune
overcloud instance connectivity issues w/ SSH etc.

Change-Id: If47ab3d3002ebe19fc980ca5d37f84f4d8851f9b
'}]
commit_message:
Puppet: wire in neutron_dnsmasq_options

This patch updates puppet on the controller so that it
configures the Neutron dnsmasq options file data with
the value provided by the Heat NeutronDnsmasqOptions
parameter.

Properly configuring this setting can help resolve/tune
overcloud instance connectivity issues w/ SSH etc.

Change-Id: If47ab3d3002ebe19fc980ca5d37f84f4d8851f9b

commit_message:
Puppet: move LB configs onto LB resources

This moves the loadbalancer composition class parameters
into the loadbalancer specific software deployment.
This keeps the resource contained and seperate from the rest
of the OS hiera data configs.

Change-Id: I8af48b479348e431a8e563917e1345ca4b895a60

This was added to master back on Dec. 1, but it was never back-
ported into Juno. There isn't another option rather than re-submitting
the patch because this was before our migration to Gerrit/Launchpad.

This should only be added to the Juno branch. The latest 10.1.2 RC

commit_message:
Include endpoint type with neutron client

This was added to master back on Dec. 1, but it was never back-
ported into Juno. There isn't another option rather than re-submitting
the patch because this was before our migration to Gerrit/Launchpad.

This should only be added to the Juno branch. The latest 10.1.2 RC
tag also needs to be rebuilt with this patch added.

Change-Id: Ib17e224f7eff4d273c77131e2b27a93224672ab1
Closes-Bug: 1418237

subject: Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1607, 'name': 'Yu xingchao', 'email': 'yuxcer@gmail.com', 'username': 'yuxcer'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14971, 'name': 'Bryan Stillwell', 'email': 'bryan.stillwell@twcable.com', 'username': 'bstillwell'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 00:08:04.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/cinder_volume_solidfire_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/cinder_backend_solidfire_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/solidfire.pp', 'manifests/volume/solidfire.pp'], 'message': "Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name

The driver name for the SolidFire driver switched back in July of 2013:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/fd139faaf3d3fc96825bbaf3397a529e5762d92c

There was a mapping of the old driver name to the new driver name until
April 2014 which is when it was removed:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/64f71b3306f7652bee60245d62af090aaa572cf7

With the Juno release the old driver name (SolidFire) can't be used any
more and must be changed to the new one (SolidFireDriver).

Change-Id: I5f127931b924209793f1d8fff4299b44b50291b7
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name

The driver name for the SolidFire driver switched back in July of 2013:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/fd139faaf3d3fc96825bbaf3397a529e5762d92c

There was a mapping of the old driver name to the new driver name until
April 2014 which is when it was removed:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/64f71b3306f7652bee60245d62af090aaa572cf7

With the Juno release the old driver name (SolidFire) can't be used any
more and must be changed to the new one (SolidFireDriver).

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-01-22 08:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/hacking/checks.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Added hacking rule for assertEqual(a in b, True/False).

The following replacements were done in tests to have
clearer messages in case of failure:
- assertEqual(a in b, True) with assertIn(a, b)
- assertEqual(a in b, False) with assertNotIn(a, b)

The error message would now be like:
   'abc' not in ['a', 'b', 'c']
rather than:
   MismatchError: False != True

Change-Id: I514daca3a470feef5d332a1a319cba15256fc6ea
"}]
commit_message:
Added hacking rule for assertEqual(a in b, True/False).

The following replacements were done in tests to have
clearer messages in case of failure:
- assertEqual(a in b, True) with assertIn(a, b)
- assertEqual(a in b, False) with assertNotIn(a, b)

The error message would now be like:
   'abc' not in ['a', 'b', 'c']
rather than:
   MismatchError: False != True

Change-Id: I514daca3a470feef5d332a1a319cba15256fc6ea

commit_message:
Remove v1.1 from v2.1 extension description

Current v2.1 os-user-data extension only includes "v1.1" in the
description, but it confuses developers/users because of mismatching
versions. In addition, the other extensions doesn't contain version
number in their descriptions.
So this patch removes v1.1 from os-user-data extension's description.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I6280a0633c0e416e4b1798a708035eaf8c979fba

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-05 02:55:10.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'novaclient/utils.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Change logic in find_resource() to identify upper-case/lower-case name.

Currently find_resource() searches resource with human_id before does
with name_attr.  With this logic, find_resource() cannot identify
upper/lower case. In find_resource(), human_id always matches and
name_attr never used in find_resource() because human_id made from
small letters of name_attr string (see bug/1318503).

To identify upper/lower case, name_attr should be used before human_id.
This fix moves name_attr to ahead of human_id with unit-test cases.

Change-Id: I9b821d7111c11a97be38f19de06172daf410022d
Closes-Bug: #1318503
'}]
commit_message:
Change logic in find_resource() to identify upper-case/lower-case name.

Currently find_resource() searches resource with human_id before does
with name_attr.  With this logic, find_resource() cannot identify
upper/lower case. In find_resource(), human_id always matches and
name_attr never used in find_resource() because human_id made from
small letters of name_attr string (see bug/1318503).

To identify upper/lower case, name_attr should be used before human_id.
This fix moves name_attr to ahead of human_id with unit-test cases.

Change-Id: I9b821d7111c11a97be38f19de06172daf410022d
Closes-Bug: #1318503

commit_message:
Fixing monasca-agent check and check_all

The command-line debugging tools "monasca-collector check check_name_here"
and "monasca-collector check_all" were hanging on the multi-threaded
ServicesCheck based agent checks.  Added calls to stop the thread pool
after the checks ran.  Removed duplicate code.

Change-Id: Iac033beafc1c055de13eba855819a881629ad55d

subject: Remove the X-Newest pre-flight request on X-Timestamp
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 1216, 'name': 'gholt', 'email': 'z-launchpad@brim.net', 'username': 'gholt'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-01-08 02:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'Remove the X-Newest pre-flight request on X-Timestamp

There is a standard LBYL race that can better be addressed by making the
EAFP case safer.

Capture 409 Conflict during expect on PUT

Similarly to how the proxy handles 412 on PUT, we will gather 409
responses in the proxy during _connect_put_node.  Rather than skipping
backend servers that already have a synced copy of an object we will
accept their response and return 202 immediately.

This is particularly useful to internal clients who are using
X-Timestamp to sync transfers (e.g. container-sync and
container-reconciler).

No observable change in client facing behavior except that swift is
faster to respond Accepted when it already has the data the client is
purposing to send.

Change-Id: Ie400d5bfd9ab28b290abce2e790889d78726095f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the X-Newest pre-flight request on X-Timestamp

There is a standard LBYL race that can better be addressed by making the
EAFP case safer.

Capture 409 Conflict during expect on PUT

Similarly to how the proxy handles 412 on PUT, we will gather 409
responses in the proxy during _connect_put_node.  Rather than skipping
backend servers that already have a synced copy of an object we will
accept their response and return 202 immediately.

This is particularly useful to internal clients who are using
X-Timestamp to sync transfers (e.g. container-sync and
container-reconciler).

No observable change in client facing behavior except that swift is
faster to respond Accepted when it already has the data the client is
purposing to send.

Change-Id: Ie400d5bfd9ab28b290abce2e790889d78726095f

subject: Introduced "naming conventions" SA feature
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-29 18:58:28.000000000', 'files': ['murano/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/003_add_action_entry.py', 'murano/db/models.py', 'murano/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/001_inital_version.py', 'murano/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/004_change_package_desc_type.py'], 'message': 'Introduced "naming conventions" SA feature

In the current state some constraints has no defined names
in the project.

So they are generated by DB engine automatically and each DB generates
constraint names in its own fashion. This makes difficult to operate
with constraints, for example in migrations, where they should be
referred by names.

SQLAlchemy provides the feature for generation of constraint names
using patterns.

Leveraging it will bring consistency to constraints naming
in the project.

Change-Id: Iee4e05dd3f0067fe90a40a9e85ffd518ed0f65f8
'}]
commit_message:
Introduced "naming conventions" SA feature

In the current state some constraints has no defined names
in the project.

So they are generated by DB engine automatically and each DB generates
constraint names in its own fashion. This makes difficult to operate
with constraints, for example in migrations, where they should be
referred by names.

SQLAlchemy provides the feature for generation of constraint names
using patterns.

Leveraging it will bring consistency to constraints naming
in the project.

Change-Id: Iee4e05dd3f0067fe90a40a9e85ffd518ed0f65f8

subject: Deprecated SQLite usage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-28 11:37:02.000000000', 'files': ['murano/cmd/db_manage.py', 'murano/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/003_add_action_entry.py', 'doc/source/install/manual.rst', 'murano/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/004_change_package_desc_type.py'], 'message': 'Deprecated SQLite usage

- SQLite is no longer recommended to use for development as well
  as for production.
- Everything related to SQLite wiped out from DB migrations,
  so they no longer can be executed on SQLite.
  More specifically - `transform_table` helper was replaced with
  Alembic commands.
- Added special commands for those who still want to use SQLite:
    `register-models` - synchronizes models with DB with "CREATE TABLE"
                        statements.
    `unregister-models` - opposite of previous command.
  With them you can avoid to use migrations and still be able to synchronize
  models with DB automatically.
- Added corresponding amendments to documentation.

See related discussion:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055055.html

Related-Bug: #1399151
Change-Id: I0c93b0f0d936aef97955ec232bd794cc15955dd2
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecated SQLite usage

- SQLite is no longer recommended to use for development as well
  as for production.
- Everything related to SQLite wiped out from DB migrations,
  so they no longer can be executed on SQLite.
  More specifically - `transform_table` helper was replaced with
  Alembic commands.
- Added special commands for those who still want to use SQLite:
    `register-models` - synchronizes models with DB with "CREATE TABLE"
                        statements.
    `unregister-models` - opposite of previous command.
  With them you can avoid to use migrations and still be able to synchronize
  models with DB automatically.
- Added corresponding amendments to documentation.

See related discussion:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055055.html

Related-Bug: #1399151
Change-Id: I0c93b0f0d936aef97955ec232bd794cc15955dd2

commit_message:
Add max_concurrent_builds limit configuration

Right now, nova-compute will attempt to build an infinite number of
instances, if asked to do so. This won't work on any machine, regardless
of the resources, if the number of instances is too large.

We could default this to zero to retain the current behavior, but
the current behavior is really not sane in any case, so I think we
should default to something. Ten instances for a single compute node
seems like as reasonable default. If you can do more than ten at a
time, you're definitely not running a cloud based on default config.

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable

Closes-Bug: #1418155

Change-Id: I412d2849fd16430e6926fc983c031babb7ad04d0

commit_message:
DevOps framework refactoring

  Remove fuel-devops.devops.manager.Manager class.
  Split models.py into separate parts.
  Change Environment model's interface.
  Change database name from 'postgres' to 'fuel-devops'.
  Reform imports.
  Move methods from fuel-main.fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel to
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment.
  Update package version from 2.6.9. to 2.9.0

Change-Id: I8de449193df44b70ddeb1b0709698ebfe0120c77
Implements: blueprint system-tests-and-devops-refactoring

commit_message:
port-list support get-port-from-mac

cli command port-show use the restapi 'get /v1/port/detail?address
={macaddress}', it also lack restapi 'get /v1/port?address={mac}'

add port-list to get the port which has macaddress:
 ironic port-list --address {macaddress}
 ironic port-list --address {macaddress} --detail

Change-Id: I4d836940974812360066b7d977472991235cb5c9
Closes-Bug: #1416627

commit_message:
support time to live on event database for MongoDB

event database will grow gradually, currently, even though we can
dump data to 3rd storage, the old data cannot be cleaned.

This patch adds a new option [database].event_time_to_live, and
create ttl index on event collection for MongoDB backend.
Also change previous [database].time_to_live to precise
[database].metering_time_to_live.

To enable test_bin, this patch also simply implements log://

partially implements blueprint event-database-ttl
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d67cf212f37d3fa5555870a8e7cbb65af205d63

commit_message:
Add missing setup.cfg entry for os-user-data plugin

Although os-user-data has an entry in nova.api.v3.extensions.server.create
in setup.cfg it is missing one in the general nova.api.v3.extensions list.
Without an entry the plugin does not appear in the extension list so this
patch adds an entry for it.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I13fa049539b07ff901b36ae18eca59fbb1354794

commit_message:
libvirt: generate proper config for PCS containers

Previous patches for PCS support allow to start virtual
machines only. For spawning containers we need to provide
os_init_path and 'filesystem' with root fs instead of
'disk'.

This patch adds basic support - you can only start
a container from an image.

Partially implements blueprint pcs-support

Change-Id: Ic19db3a6798de060f0eda75947b69a71c4a0fcbc

Extend class LibvirtConfigGuestFilesys so it will be
possible to add filesystems of type 'block' and 'file'
for libvirt domain xml. Since 1.0.6 libvirt can setup
loop or nbd device, mount root fs and start container
from that fs. Filesystems of type 'file' also used in
parallels driver for containers.

Also add method libvirt_fs_info to class Image, so you
can get libvirt's config for given Image object with
one call.

Partially implements blueprint pcs-support

Change-Id: I62004a2a48827e869d3a7534e94dda2d6a067497
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add ability to add file and block based filesystem

Extend class LibvirtConfigGuestFilesys so it will be
possible to add filesystems of type 'block' and 'file'
for libvirt domain xml. Since 1.0.6 libvirt can setup
loop or nbd device, mount root fs and start container
from that fs. Filesystems of type 'file' also used in
parallels driver for containers.

Also add method libvirt_fs_info to class Image, so you
can get libvirt's config for given Image object with
one call.

Partially implements blueprint pcs-support

Change-Id: I62004a2a48827e869d3a7534e94dda2d6a067497

commit_message:
Update Power State after deleting instance

Update the power state for an instance when deleting it.
Instead of being stuck in the 'Running' power state after deletion,
a deleted instance will be in the NOSTATE power state.

Change-Id: I2be9094af21e00868ad066118e94355b09f64346
Closes-Bug: #1392798

commit_message:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/hacking/tag/?id=0.10.0

Fix code issues with H238 and W292.

subject: Remove min and max from base.Version
revisions:

The min and max attributes from the base.Version class is not needed,
it was set and used before when checking versions but right now we only

Change-Id: Ic501db26a00c96ca55eb8fbcfc7b318599a48158
'}]
commit_message:
Remove min and max from base.Version

The min and max attributes from the base.Version class is not needed,
it was set and used before when checking versions but right now we only
use the major and minor attributes.

Change-Id: Ic501db26a00c96ca55eb8fbcfc7b318599a48158

commit_message:
Revert "Make neutron the default in devstack"

The simple case of a single interface doesn't work
out of the box, and this is now failing for lots of 
people. We need to back up and get that working.

This reverts commit c906bb38851037880f557b15ad30c9b0bb7fa295.

Change-Id: If20df670e06cda2d65028bceb46d257d011cf917

commit_message:
add _LW for log functions in API layer

The pep8 check only checks format LOG.warning but
it didn't check logger.warning, and nova need to translate
the warning messages.
This patch also replace a warn with warning due to py3 compatible.

Change-Id: I32078b9acde6070e1e3dc784a492b08b83926f3f

commit_message:
kombu: fix driver loading with kombu+qpid scheme

When a url looks like: kombu+qpid:///host:port/ the driver fail
to load.

This change fixes that, adds a warning message that this kind of
URL is experimental and not yet supported.

Also our Consumer code use internal kombu API that can be optionnal
implemented by the kombu transport (message_to_python),
so check that this one exists before using it.

In the future, we should use kombu.messaging.Consumer/Publisher
instead of Consumer/Publisher implementation to avoid such hack...

Change-Id: I066d57c23bff922c5734ab036b6ca8e1608e5c6a

commit_message:
mirror/centos: fix downloading of src.rpm's

An old version was downloading everything (including the upsteam sources)
and completely ingnoring errors. As a side effect only used to be
downloaded. Later on a proper error handling has been added, which break
downloadin src.rpm's. Fix the download rules so only Mirantis' sources
get fetched.

Change-Id: I1c43e0bb38a7fea34f1c7b2b9eb701a734341268
Closes-Bug: #1418390

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-24 02:46:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix StaleDataError on DVR bind update

If a router is deleted concurrently while a router port is being bound,
the update query may fail because of the empty resultset.

To avoid this error, this patch moves the committed udpdate under the
same db context that validates that the port still exists, before the
update.

This change should not lead to unexpected surprises or unveil new
failure modes. Alternatively, it would be safer to catch the StaleDataError
and gracefully log that the router has been deleted while processing the
dvr binding.

This patch takes the bolder, and slightly cleaner approach.

Change-Id: I223d08dd3202c4a578db3d8257d9b76f66129a75
Closes-bug: #1372141
'}]
commit_message:
Fix StaleDataError on DVR bind update

If a router is deleted concurrently while a router port is being bound,
the update query may fail because of the empty resultset.

To avoid this error, this patch moves the committed udpdate under the
same db context that validates that the port still exists, before the
update.

This change should not lead to unexpected surprises or unveil new
failure modes. Alternatively, it would be safer to catch the StaleDataError
and gracefully log that the router has been deleted while processing the
dvr binding.

This patch takes the bolder, and slightly cleaner approach.

Change-Id: I223d08dd3202c4a578db3d8257d9b76f66129a75
Closes-bug: #1372141

commit_message:
Puppet: Ntp support

This patch adds NTP support to all roles.

As part of this change overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml has
also been updated so that it passes the NtpServer parameters into
the Swift and Cinder storage node templates so that Ntp can
also be configured on those machines as well.

NOTE: The puppet support here uses the puppetlabs-ntp modules
which we add in Ib10ccbfdb3140b19f40049707548c6655d250e1c.

Change-Id: If2ef236fa42a714e84c6944eee5fe4daddf3fedf

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-02-05 03:13:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/__init__.py', 'ironic/common/exception.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/common/states.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Add MANAGEABLE state and associated transitions

This patch adds the MANAGEABLE state, and associated transitions to and
from AVAILABLE, as well as a new RPC method to initiate transitions
between provisioning states.

It also adds a new VERBS entity to ironic/common/states.py to hold the
action-phrases, as described in blueprint new-ironic-state-machine. This
provides a single place to check whether a requested target state is
allowed to be requested by checking if the value is "in" the keys of
this dictionary. It also provides a mapping for two phrases which are
currently inconsistent:
  target:deleted -> action:delete
  target:active  -> action:deploy

It updates the API controller for nodes.py without changing the HTTP
status codes which are returned in exception cases. The changes in unit
tests now prepare the node appropriately, but do not change the
assertions being tested.

Juno allowed the rebuild of a failed deploy to be initiated by PUTting
a target state of "active"; this behavior, while inconsistent with the
new state machine, is added to the state model for compatibility, now
that stronger checking is done within the API service, based on the
actual modelling of state transitions.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id0af5a607b7432d287eef643c1e30e324dc4f879
'}]
commit_message:
Add MANAGEABLE state and associated transitions

This patch adds the MANAGEABLE state, and associated transitions to and
from AVAILABLE, as well as a new RPC method to initiate transitions
between provisioning states.

It also adds a new VERBS entity to ironic/common/states.py to hold the
action-phrases, as described in blueprint new-ironic-state-machine. This
provides a single place to check whether a requested target state is
allowed to be requested by checking if the value is "in" the keys of
this dictionary. It also provides a mapping for two phrases which are
currently inconsistent:
  target:deleted -> action:delete
  target:active  -> action:deploy

It updates the API controller for nodes.py without changing the HTTP
status codes which are returned in exception cases. The changes in unit
tests now prepare the node appropriately, but do not change the
assertions being tested.

Juno allowed the rebuild of a failed deploy to be initiated by PUTting
a target state of "active"; this behavior, while inconsistent with the
new state machine, is added to the state model for compatibility, now
that stronger checking is done within the API service, based on the
actual modelling of state transitions.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id0af5a607b7432d287eef643c1e30e324dc4f879

commit_message:
Fix up help message for reset-state call

There's some confusion about what the reset-state
call does.  It's not clear to some that this call
simply changes the state of the object in the data-base.

This patch just updates the help message to indicate more
clearly that reset-state ONLY changes state in the DB.

subject: add --no-traits for event-list
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 7052, 'name': 'Fabio Giannetti', 'email': 'fgiannet@cisco.com', 'username': 'fabgia'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 13273, 'name': 'Lena Novokshonova', 'email': 'enovokshonova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'enovokshonova'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-05 03:11:53.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/v2/shell.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'add --no-traits for event-list

Currently we print traits list for each event when run event-list
command, but that is a lot of information. After system run for a
few days, the event-list command prints so much that it is not
convenient to know the whole event-list even with less command.

This patch adds a simple argument called --no-traits, it is False
by default, event-list will not print traits if this argument is
specified. Since this argument is boolean type, no need to assign
a value, if it is specified, then it is actived.

Change-Id: Ib69209fef5967a18f094f2d4665fa189e4ca3e6a
'}]
commit_message:
add --no-traits for event-list

Currently we print traits list for each event when run event-list
command, but that is a lot of information. After system run for a
few days, the event-list command prints so much that it is not
convenient to know the whole event-list even with less command.

This patch adds a simple argument called --no-traits, it is False
by default, event-list will not print traits if this argument is
specified. Since this argument is boolean type, no need to assign
a value, if it is specified, then it is actived.

Change-Id: Ib69209fef5967a18f094f2d4665fa189e4ca3e6a

commit_message:
Enable and resolve some PEP8 issues

* E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
* H501 don't use locals() for formatting strings. to also check
* H402 first line of docstring should end with punctuation
* E122 continuation line missing indentation or outdented
* E713 test for membership should be 'not in'

Change-Id: I4a30350778a4452075e468400effcbc4155d24d8

commit_message:
Fix notifications broken with ZMQ driver

The notification message did not contain a method keyword,
so it was ignored by consumers. Another in dispatch, the
notification msg confilict with other method.

Change-Id: I7c60c6f80006222d3cbe818d32288d043b55a7b8
Closes-Bug:#1368154

commit_message:
Integrate destroy baseline into driver

Provides a baseline for the destroy method in nova.  Updates the unit
tests as well.

Utilizes TaskFlow (but no roll back yet).  Future updates will provide
that capability.

Also updates the blockdev as there are new methods needed.  Had to
remove a rollback condition in the spawn due to these new methods.

Changed the way that the media deletion is done.  This new method should
be more efficient and complete.

Change-Id: I3909bd58af9b9a984f94f42de0d539c6d8b45fb0

DocImpact

subject: Detect the left/right boundary of an aggregate
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-02-03 11:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/test_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py'], 'message': 'Detect the left/right boundary of an aggregate

In case of to_timestamp and/or from_timestamp are not set, perhaps
not all timeseries have received the first/last datapoints,
this change allows to do the aggregation in this case
by returning only the last range of common datapoints.

Change-Id: I8896107b09cddd7dd1626dc685c48296cf0276f1
'}]
commit_message:
Detect the left/right boundary of an aggregate

In case of to_timestamp and/or from_timestamp are not set, perhaps
not all timeseries have received the first/last datapoints,
this change allows to do the aggregation in this case
by returning only the last range of common datapoints.

Change-Id: I8896107b09cddd7dd1626dc685c48296cf0276f1

commit_message:
Remove Fedora 19 as supported distribution

Fedora 19 will reach its end of life on 6-JAN-2015

  https://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/announce/2014-December/003243.html

Remove it as a supported distribution and add Fedora 21

  - stack.sh: Remove Fedora 19 from list of 'supported' distributions.
  - tools/fixup_stuff.sh: Remove Fedora 19. Also remove the workaround
    of disabling firewalld for Fedora 21.

Change-Id: If92b87d2f9a2bb95469730cda201a7981670f727
(cherry picked from commit 7c9df1017cb249afd329e915aab8a04b04940bc2)
