commit_message:
Problem with heading: "Launch an instance from an image" Section 1 with following command example:

"The following command launches the MyCirrosServer instance with the m1.small flavor (ID of 1), cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec image (ID of 397e713c-b95b-4186-ad46-6126863ea0a9), default security group, KeyPair01 key, and a user data file called cloudinit.file:

$ nova boot --flavor 1 --image 397e713c-b95b-4186-ad46-6126863ea0a9 \
  --security-groups default --key-name KeyPair01 --user-data cloudinit.file \
  myCirrosServer

"

After the example command, it shows the sample output in the table where it lists the key_name incorrectly:

 key_name | None | ==> instead of

 key_name | KeyPair01 |

commit_message:
Small improvements Sahara and Murano tests

1. Method for calculating max free RAM for one of the compute nodes
   was slightly reworked.

2. In setUp method (in muranomanager.py) the check of free RAM for
   compute nodes was directly moved to the test because this check
   was also executed and for sanity Murano tests.

3. Messages for users were slightly corrected for more understanding.

4. The part of code in Sahara tests that is related to deleting
   resources was slightly reworked.

Change-Id: Iafd6cefdb08034503cc7e0a3293768d658cdff56

OSWL_COLLECT_PERIOD = 1 is recommended for normal operation.

subject: Improve Trove's check job execution
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-04 15:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Improve Trove's check job execution

Reasons:
- to avoid gate overfilling, it is necessary to provide advanced
  way to lauch jobs, the most valid way is to use 'files'
  directive, similar to requirements job.

Changes:
- for each datastore check job was added 'files' directive except
  'mysql' job since in Trove it is required to run mysql
  test case for every patchsets, same thing for percona (since it
  is another mysql community flavor, and runs in
  Trove under shared mysql driver)
- 'files' directive include those files modification to which
  should lead to check job, for example:
  - 'files' for couchbase, postgresql includes
    guestagent/strategies/* files since those
    datastores are supporting backup/restore using Trove API

Change-Id: Ib094817759a3aafa6d68390b36d02632a4183487
"}]
commit_message:
Improve Trove's check job execution

Reasons:
- to avoid gate overfilling, it is necessary to provide advanced
  way to lauch jobs, the most valid way is to use 'files'
  directive, similar to requirements job.

Changes:
- for each datastore check job was added 'files' directive except
  'mysql' job since in Trove it is required to run mysql
  test case for every patchsets, same thing for percona (since it
  is another mysql community flavor, and runs in
  Trove under shared mysql driver)
- 'files' directive include those files modification to which
  should lead to check job, for example:
  - 'files' for couchbase, postgresql includes
    guestagent/strategies/* files since those
    datastores are supporting backup/restore using Trove API

Change-Id: Ib094817759a3aafa6d68390b36d02632a4183487

commit_message:
Update status names

'ing' ending implies that the action is in progress,
do status name were changed from 'deploy in progress' and
'delete in progress' to 'deploying' and 'deleting' respectively.

commit_message:
Add a multi VM image support in multi HV for astute

* Added case for both enabled HV: vcenter and kvm.
* Old functionality(image_data with one image only) has beeh saved because
  UI part is not completed now.

Related part for astute: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151211

Change-Id: I49505eebe45d7d909c6578ccf5f7d4cb45ee1ce9
Implements: blueprint vmware-dual-hypervisor

commit_message:
Refactor the ProcessMonitor _exit_handler to ProcessMonitor

We allowed to provide an specific _exit_handler, but in
the end all the implementations are providing the same
one. So, now it's refactored back to the monitor, and
removed any YAGNI code.

Partially implements: bp/agent-child-processes-status

Change-Id: I916feb631885324bc98da1b1350915e14b6fcadc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 03:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/extensions.py'], 'message': 'Fix breakage in all service repo unit tests, due to duplicate imports of exts

Duplicate imports of the same class + super() are not playing nicely
together, and our unit test base classes cause some dups in the extension
search path, breaking the service repos. This was not noticed earlier
in the extension moving process, because the temporary move code had a crude
mechanism to prevent the loading of same named extensions.

Change-Id: I0fbb2dbc01c67bb47a79f630ad352d1d92b6bb91
Partially-Implements: blueprint services-split
'}]
commit_message:
Fix breakage in all service repo unit tests, due to duplicate imports of exts

Duplicate imports of the same class + super() are not playing nicely
together, and our unit test base classes cause some dups in the extension
search path, breaking the service repos. This was not noticed earlier
in the extension moving process, because the temporary move code had a crude
mechanism to prevent the loading of same named extensions.

Change-Id: I0fbb2dbc01c67bb47a79f630ad352d1d92b6bb91
Partially-Implements: blueprint services-split

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-05 02:30:46.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/__init__.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/base.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_root.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_base.py'], 'message': 'Raise minimum API version to 1.1

When we added microversion support to the API, the initial and minimum
version was set to 1.0. However, there were five previous API changes
since the Juno release which are not discoverable through the API
versioning scheme.

The 1.0 tag should actually indicate "Juno stable API". This patch
advances the minimum API version to 1.1, retroactively changing the
versions applied by two prior features:

* 1.1 -> 1.2 Rename NOSTATE to Available
* 1.2 -> 1.3 Add Node.driver_internal_info

Also, the default version applied (when no
X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header is supplied) is raised to 1.1. A
client request that does not specify the header will retain the same
behavior as before this patch -- namely, the behavior prior to commit
I34bf7fa1b21580337c18206798dd8e9dfe11ba09. A client request which
specifies a version of 1.0 will result in an HTTP 406 Unsupported error
code today.

This patch leaves open the possibility for retroactively adding support
for the Juno API in future patches during the Kilo cycles, if necessary.

Change-Id: I7bc10ce72a461b8b68f5e07e1f27ec053f72a41a
'}]
commit_message:
Raise minimum API version to 1.1

When we added microversion support to the API, the initial and minimum
version was set to 1.0. However, there were five previous API changes
since the Juno release which are not discoverable through the API
versioning scheme.

The 1.0 tag should actually indicate "Juno stable API". This patch
advances the minimum API version to 1.1, retroactively changing the
versions applied by two prior features:

* 1.1 -> 1.2 Rename NOSTATE to Available
* 1.2 -> 1.3 Add Node.driver_internal_info

Also, the default version applied (when no
X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header is supplied) is raised to 1.1. A
client request that does not specify the header will retain the same
behavior as before this patch -- namely, the behavior prior to commit
I34bf7fa1b21580337c18206798dd8e9dfe11ba09. A client request which
specifies a version of 1.0 will result in an HTTP 406 Unsupported error
code today.

This patch leaves open the possibility for retroactively adding support
for the Juno API in future patches during the Kilo cycles, if necessary.

Change-Id: I7bc10ce72a461b8b68f5e07e1f27ec053f72a41a

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-03 13:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/shell.py', 'glanceclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Use utils.exit rather than print+sys.exit

This replaces the use of a pattern along the lines of

    print(error message)
    sys.exit(1)

in a couple of place in the shell. utils.exit does much the same job,
but outputs to stderr.

Change-Id: I1d3b52e0685772c10aa806a8f208eb6dd7a0e7ef
'}]
commit_message:
Use utils.exit rather than print+sys.exit

This replaces the use of a pattern along the lines of

    print(error message)
    sys.exit(1)

in a couple of place in the shell. utils.exit does much the same job,
but outputs to stderr.

Change-Id: I1d3b52e0685772c10aa806a8f208eb6dd7a0e7ef

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2015-01-30 09:35:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/config.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_driver.py', 'neutron/agent/metadata/driver.py', 'etc/l3_agent.ini'], 'message': 'Allow to request metadata proxy only with redirection

metadata service should be requested on 169.254.169.254:80 and router
namespace iptables rules redirect the request to the metadata-ns-proxy
on 127.0.0.1:$metadata_port. But currently the metadata-ns-proxy can be
requested directly on $router-ip:$metadata_port.

To avoid such behavior, this change marks packets redirection in mangle
table (PREROUTING), redirects (PREROUTING) them in nat table, accepts
them in filter table (INPUT) using the mark. Packets send to the
metadata proxy port without mark (so directly) are dropped. The
mark can be configured through the new option metadata_access_mark.

Remark: redirected packets are not local packets (in general), so
setting metadata proxy server host to 127.0.0.1 will disallow direct
queries but so redirected queries.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1187102
Change-Id: I6a9bb12c8bf68c6fcf4e4060f8dfe44a309a41da
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to request metadata proxy only with redirection

metadata service should be requested on 169.254.169.254:80 and router
namespace iptables rules redirect the request to the metadata-ns-proxy
on 127.0.0.1:$metadata_port. But currently the metadata-ns-proxy can be
requested directly on $router-ip:$metadata_port.

To avoid such behavior, this change marks packets redirection in mangle
table (PREROUTING), redirects (PREROUTING) them in nat table, accepts
them in filter table (INPUT) using the mark. Packets send to the
metadata proxy port without mark (so directly) are dropped. The
mark can be configured through the new option metadata_access_mark.

Remark: redirected packets are not local packets (in general), so
setting metadata proxy server host to 127.0.0.1 will disallow direct
queries but so redirected queries.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1187102
Change-Id: I6a9bb12c8bf68c6fcf4e4060f8dfe44a309a41da

commit_message:
Allow Periodic Sync to be restricted to a subset of zones

Pool Manager's periodic sync should allow for sync'ing only zone changed
in the last N seconds.

Change-Id: I0c338500970b840646deb0552d7ab02b1ecf6621
Closes-Bug: 1412598

commit_message:
Refactor ilo.deploy._get_single_nic_with_vif_port_id()

Move ilo.deploy._get_single_nic_with_vif_port_id() to
deploy_utils.get_single_nic_with_vif_port_id() in order to share
between iLO driver and iRMC driver as a common function.

Change-Id: I0539e5fa3c8810f9cd8f2b8560e17b3eb2eb64aa
blueprint: irmc-virtualmedia-deploy-driver

commit_message:
If router is HA, get current_cidrs from keepalived object

When using L3 HA and keepalived neutron is no longer directly managing
the floating IP addresses itself. Neutron should not check against
which addresses are currently configured on the system, but the
addresses the keepalived object has configured.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py

Co-Authored-By: Benoit Page-Guitard <benoit.page@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I56045ede3a3dc1a7044a22913ee38ed382a81052
Closes-Bug: #1400217
(cherry picked from commit ccd5fe83884cf72c7e69091f318628884665f971)

commit_message:
libvirt: Use XPath instead of loop in _get_all_block_devices

etree supports XPath to find specific node, so we don't need
find the node with comparing its tag and attribute. This commit
uses Xpath in method _get_all_block_devices.

Partial-Bug: #1407915

Change-Id: I554392873ae61f0007a8d13d906852fb2582eb47

commit_message:
libvirt: Use XPath instead of loop in get_instance_diagnostics

etree supports XPath to find specific node, so we don't need
find the node with comparing its tag and attribute. This commit
uses Xpath in method get_instance_diagnostics. And expanded
libvirt driver tests.

Partial-Bug: #1407915

Change-Id: Ic1bb60935fb8101bcadf3618e7ef41015036211f

Custom action for arbitrary commands

Support Nailgun hooks action as separate action.
This help us for tasks necessary for Fuel preparation
instead of cluster preparation

Implements blueprint downloadable-ubuntu-release

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-03 16:31:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_hds_nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_nexenta.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'RemoteFS: Use nas_ip and nas_share_path options

This replaces the <x>fs_shares_config file configuration
options with the existing nas_ip option and new
nas_share_path and nas_mount_options configuration
options.

This means that RemoteFS drivers will manage a single
export rather than a handful of unrelated exports.

If the nas_ip and nas_share_path options are set, they
are used.  If not, the previous configuration mechanism,
based on loading a set of shares from a file configured
by <x>fs_shares_config will be used.

Also use nas_mount_options to replace
nfs_mount_options for consistency.  If nas_mount_options
is not set, nfs_mount_options will be used for
compatibility.

Implements blueprint: remotefs-share-cfg-improvements
DocImpact: new configuration options

Change-Id: Ic72ae6c7fdd2c6a7fea27152f27c6521a561977b
'}]
commit_message:
RemoteFS: Use nas_ip and nas_share_path options

This replaces the <x>fs_shares_config file configuration
options with the existing nas_ip option and new
nas_share_path and nas_mount_options configuration
options.

This means that RemoteFS drivers will manage a single
export rather than a handful of unrelated exports.

If the nas_ip and nas_share_path options are set, they
are used.  If not, the previous configuration mechanism,
based on loading a set of shares from a file configured
by <x>fs_shares_config will be used.

Also use nas_mount_options to replace
nfs_mount_options for consistency.  If nas_mount_options
is not set, nfs_mount_options will be used for
compatibility.

Implements blueprint: remotefs-share-cfg-improvements
DocImpact: new configuration options

Change-Id: Ic72ae6c7fdd2c6a7fea27152f27c6521a561977b

commit_message:
Configures RADVD to send managed flag in RA
for DHCP_STATEFUL

RADVD process is configured so that it sends
managed flag in RA for the subnets with
ra_mode set to DHCP_STATEFUL. UT case is
updated to check the presence of managed
flag in config file of RADVD for
DHCP_STATEFUL.

Change-Id: If685846c0c0f67bf4c40f4f268b9d03bfa2b1654
Closes-Bug: #1377843
(cherry picked from commit 1f337c761bf73df050e435214935c498a2b3d028)

commit_message:
fuel_agent: removed reread_partitions method

This reread_partitions method was a desperate attempt
to work around udev related "device is busy" error.
The correct way to deal with that stuff is to use
udevadm --settle which is to block thread until udev is
ready to handle events.

Closes-Bug: 1410471
Change-Id: Idb0dccb35aab10d02c5ad942fd30d52a461e1a0e

subject: [IBP] Kill nailgun-agent if provisioning was started
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 17:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/manager.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/utils/utils.py'], 'message': "[IBP] Kill nailgun-agent if provisioning was started

It should be killed to avoid cpu being ate by 'blkid -s TYPE',
'blkid -s UUID', 'blkid -s LABEL' calls from ohai.

That saves some available cpu time for the sake of partitioning.

Change-Id: I1708273c3b4d6d44238c78a395a1aea211ed58eb
Related-bug: #1410471
"}]
commit_message:
[IBP] Kill nailgun-agent if provisioning was started

It should be killed to avoid cpu being ate by 'blkid -s TYPE',
'blkid -s UUID', 'blkid -s LABEL' calls from ohai.

That saves some available cpu time for the sake of partitioning.

Change-Id: I1708273c3b4d6d44238c78a395a1aea211ed58eb
Related-bug: #1410471

commit_message:
Set random password for root user

Random password will be set for root user.
For the first time it will be printed to console (stderr).
Also after the first use, the password will expire.

Change-Id: I0b5c0edaa6107eb90a73bae7cb546e27d50ec6b3
Closes-Bug: #1413456

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-03 10:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/nmanager.py'], 'message': 'fix ostf test check connect without floating IP

There is ostf test "Check network connectivity from instance without
floating IP" which don't works in HA vCenter based environment after
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122242/ was merged.

It happens, because test uses wrong node to make ssh tunnel to
instance of vm. This patch helps to test choose correct node.

Change-Id: Idb42e955b2b6322c565e080235873899b3298562
Closes-Bug: #1417167
'}]
commit_message:
fix ostf test check connect without floating IP

There is ostf test "Check network connectivity from instance without
floating IP" which don't works in HA vCenter based environment after
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122242/ was merged.

It happens, because test uses wrong node to make ssh tunnel to
instance of vm. This patch helps to test choose correct node.

Change-Id: Idb42e955b2b6322c565e080235873899b3298562
Closes-Bug: #1417167

commit_message:
Add policy show_password to mask passwords in driver_info

Ironic API already enforces admin role to run node-show. So a new
policy show_password is added to control if plain text passwords
in driver_info should be masked or not before sending back to
API calls. The default is masking password for all cases.

Change-Id: Icd3e6be049376bf7b4468f0c149a72a06643da32
Closes-Bug: #1406191

commit_message:
Hotfix for revert admin node after suspending

Remove resuming the environment after all snapshots due to
a lot of failures.

Move the method 'store_astute_yaml' to the separate decorator
to be used with methods that perform deploy a cluster.

Change-Id: Icbc81170697d7a5aa85c16c50a42563fe7fbcd60
Closes-Bug: #1418111

commit_message:
Move suspend/resume autoscaling tests to functional

Note:
- there is no special suspend/resume logic in the autoscaling code
  (this is just calling the nested stack's action)
- this patch includes a basic functional test to suspend/resume.

part of blueprint decouple-nested

Change-Id: I506a8e8258ebfb136637645e51b1faf3a7be4260

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-04 01:48:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': 'Not assign dynamic IPv6 address on dhcp interface

When SLAAC IPv6 subnet using external router advertisement
(ipv6_ra_mode=None, ipv6_address_mode=slaac) is added to a
dual-stack network, the device of dnsmasq or router gateway may
already be assigned with dynamic SLAAC IPv6 address. Current
code only checks for permanent address on a device when
initilizing the l3 address of that device. This results
assigning duplicated address to dhcp tap device, which leads
to dhcp agent failure.

This fix changes dhcp code to not init dynamic IPv6 address
on dhcp device so dynamic address can be auto-configured by
either internal or external RA device.

Change-Id: I72b85eb93d1849299d523eedf563ab201b4a0352
Closes-Bug:1409634
'}]
commit_message:
Not assign dynamic IPv6 address on dhcp interface

When SLAAC IPv6 subnet using external router advertisement
(ipv6_ra_mode=None, ipv6_address_mode=slaac) is added to a
dual-stack network, the device of dnsmasq or router gateway may
already be assigned with dynamic SLAAC IPv6 address. Current
code only checks for permanent address on a device when
initilizing the l3 address of that device. This results
assigning duplicated address to dhcp tap device, which leads
to dhcp agent failure.

This fix changes dhcp code to not init dynamic IPv6 address
on dhcp device so dynamic address can be auto-configured by
either internal or external RA device.

Change-Id: I72b85eb93d1849299d523eedf563ab201b4a0352
Closes-Bug:1409634

commit_message:
Respect original plugin tasks order

Original order:

- puppet1
- shell1
- puppet2
- shell2

Order before this change:

- puppet1
- puppet2
- shell1
- shell2

Order now:

- puppet1
- shell1
- puppet2
- shell2

Change-Id: I203fd5a00e628aac465a55a8e219e5fb130efbd8
Closes-Bug: #1417537
